commit_message:
Remove a outdated warning

this document is out of date since a set of changes made such as

43f91a87cb4f14078d39d8ce6e8308f4b37eac74
39f6159bde1102b2409defe2865f7ee40901d866
8be8d02aa77ebbe6687fa9ec4c74949cde0bf596

Put those 'to be fixed in queens' make people think it should
be already been fixed due to queen release, so remove them in order
to avoid confusion and we can continue to enhance this doc.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I12dd385f4e1f159bdb9a78a629d4095889397c09

commit_message:
Move pypowervm requirement to 1.1.12

pypowervm needs to be 1.1.12 or later for PowerVM vSCSI cinder volume
support [1].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526094/

Change-Id: I3bb4359c04ec8e1e9ece09670e108cd023d0f558

This is to fix below typos in release notes:

  availabilty
  maange
  expetected

commit_message:
Use oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures

The change in I25e41fc4103b4eafd3aef2b0a863b2053927edad
makes use of oslo_db.tests.*, which was not the intent of the
deprecations added to oslo_db in
I0163e637ffef6d45d2573ebe29b5438911d01fce.   Make use of the
newer fixtures in oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_fixtures which is
what was intended to supersede oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base.

Change-Id: I67cd8f032cbc4be6469ccb90b9f9a6e552bd963d
(cherry picked from commit 139c93223469ed5c04e5816157047b38f5f22bc9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 13:24:43.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-fw: Fix firewall blink

Previously, when security group was updated for given port, the firewall
removed all flows related to the port and added new rules. That
introduced a time window where there were no rules for the port.

This patch adds a new mechanism using cookie that can be described in
three states:

1) Create new openflow rules with non-default cookie that is considered
an updated cookie. All newly generated flows will be added with the next
cookie and all existing rules with default cookie are rewritten with the
default cookie.
2) Delete all rules for given port with the old default cookie. This
will leave the newly added rules in place.
3) Update the newly added flows with update cookie back to the default
cookie in order to avoid such flows being cleaned on the next restart of
ovs agent, as it fetches for stale flows.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/test_firewall.py

Change-Id: I85d9e49c24ee7c91229b43cd329c42149637f254
Closes-bug: #1708731
(cherry picked from commit 6f7ba76075dd0d645ad6cee6854f87cc41cba1fa)

2) Delete all rules for given port with the old default cookie. This

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/test_firewall.py

Change-Id: I85d9e49c24ee7c91229b43cd329c42149637f254
Closes-bug: #1708731
(cherry picked from commit 6f7ba76075dd0d645ad6cee6854f87cc41cba1fa)
'}]
commit_message:
ovs-fw: Fix firewall blink

Previously, when security group was updated for given port, the firewall
removed all flows related to the port and added new rules. That
introduced a time window where there were no rules for the port.

This patch adds a new mechanism using cookie that can be described in
three states:

1) Create new openflow rules with non-default cookie that is considered
an updated cookie. All newly generated flows will be added with the next
cookie and all existing rules with default cookie are rewritten with the
default cookie.
2) Delete all rules for given port with the old default cookie. This
will leave the newly added rules in place.
3) Update the newly added flows with update cookie back to the default
cookie in order to avoid such flows being cleaned on the next restart of
ovs agent, as it fetches for stale flows.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/test_firewall.py

Change-Id: I85d9e49c24ee7c91229b43cd329c42149637f254
Closes-bug: #1708731
(cherry picked from commit 6f7ba76075dd0d645ad6cee6854f87cc41cba1fa)

commit_message:
remove unnecessary cleanup in nova startup

nova's instances directory may be a shared directory (ie nfs), in
these cases, we do not want to call nova_cleanup at startup since it
deletes everything under $NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH.

The nova_cleanup routine will still be called by the clean.sh script
which is fine since we're presumably cleaning up the whole openstack
cluster at that point.

Change-Id: Ieb4e5d0508d4ed4c5349c497554c5da2993c9cb0
Closes-Bug: #1649389

the folder path correctly.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 10:39:24.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.
This patch makes it self maintaining. Note that due to the fact
that RDO/SUSE do not implement their repositories for a new
release until much, much later in the cycle, we use the previous
release repo for master. This will self-update during our RC
when the stable branch is cut.

Some formatting adjustments have made to prevent the interpretation
of URL's as links by sphinx and to remove the use of multi-line shell
commands.

Closes-Bug: #1759721
Change-Id: Id28540d335390a52e0eb65a734a1d594235265d6

Note that due to the fact that this is a stable branch and that

this is a re-implementation rather than a backport.

commands.

Closes-Bug: #1759721
Change-Id: Id28540d335390a52e0eb65a734a1d594235265d6
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.
This patch makes it self maintaining.

Note that due to the fact that this is a stable branch and that
the documentation configuration is vastly different to master,
this is a re-implementation rather than a backport.

Some formatting adjustments have made to prevent the interpretation
of URL's as links by sphinx and to remove the use of multi-line shell
commands.

Closes-Bug: #1759721
Change-Id: Id28540d335390a52e0eb65a734a1d594235265d6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 16:57:31.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce limestone max-servers to 30

We are seeing job timeouts on limestone. Theory is this is due to cpu
contention. By reducing max-servers we will reduce contention and should
make jobs happier.

Change-Id: I74562f80e54f2a6b02b8b8ab7249129724ed2174
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce limestone max-servers to 30

We are seeing job timeouts on limestone. Theory is this is due to cpu
contention. By reducing max-servers we will reduce contention and should
make jobs happier.

Change-Id: I74562f80e54f2a6b02b8b8ab7249129724ed2174

commit_message:
Switch from testrepository to stestr

This commit replaces the call to testr with stestr, and updates the
output files accordingly. This is necessary because tempest has moved
away from testrepository [1], which is resulting in empty files being
created.

Lastly, we update the functional tests to ensure the subunit results
files exist and are not empty.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504345/

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557988/
Change-Id: I2496fccff1f51c586e999538232a4bcf0addbee5
(cherry picked from commit f8404f5eeb2a07382782d63e126fae54b9383439)

commit_message:
Add a new FAQ entry for dev environments

Since it's pretty common to see blogposts recommending to mount /opt/stack
remotely or editing inline the code, adding some notes about the potential
risk of a reclone that could impact weeks of work.

Change-Id: I733d40b76fb02d8edf3719533fc8202547771871
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 03:37:52.000000000', 'message': "Only leader actions bump state_timestamp

The state of a shard range can be changed at different times in
different processes, but should always make forwards progress. If one
replica of a shard range has already moved to a state that is ahead
that of another replica then the most advanced state should be
preserved irrespective of the time at which each replica reached their
current state.

The only time a shard range state needs to move 'backwards' is when a
final shard range shrinks back to a root, when the root needs to
change from sharded state to active state. This transition should only
be performed by a single 'leader' process and it is therefore
acceptable to increase the state_timestamp at that moment in time so
that the active state takes precedence over any other more advanced
state with an older timestamp.

In general, the state timestamp can be increased whenever a single
'leader' is singularly responsible for performing a state transition.

Change-Id: I0a38db0a56645fc5c0b0fcf2cbd89a3b5f31cebf
"}, {'created': '2018-04-02 16:28:36.000000000', 'message': "Only leader actions bump state_timestamp

The state of a shard range can be changed at different times in
different processes, but should always make forwards progress. If one
replica of a shard range has already moved to a state that is ahead
that of another replica then the most advanced state should be
preserved irrespective of the time at which each replica reached their
current state.

The only time a shard range state needs to move 'backwards' is when a
final shard range shrinks back to a root, when the root needs to
change from sharded state to active state. This transition should only
be performed by a single 'leader' process and it is therefore
acceptable to increase the state_timestamp at that moment in time so
that the active state takes precedence over any other more advanced
state with an older timestamp.

In general, the state timestamp can be increased whenever a single
'leader' is singularly responsible for performing a state transition.

current state.

The only time a shard range state needs to move 'backwards' is when a
final shard range shrinks back to a root, when the root needs to
change from sharded state to active state. This transition should only
be performed by a single 'leader' process and it is therefore
acceptable to increase the state_timestamp at that moment in time so
that the active state takes precedence over any other more advanced
state with an older timestamp.

commit_message:
Only leader actions bump state_timestamp

The state of a shard range can be changed at different times in
different processes, but should always make forwards progress. If one
replica of a shard range has already moved to a state that is ahead
that of another replica then the most advanced state should be
preserved irrespective of the time at which each replica reached their
current state.

The only time a shard range state needs to move 'backwards' is when a
final shard range shrinks back to a root, when the root needs to
change from sharded state to active state. This transition should only
be performed by a single 'leader' process and it is therefore
acceptable to increase the state_timestamp at that moment in time so
that the active state takes precedence over any other more advanced
state with an older timestamp.

In general, the state timestamp can be increased whenever a single
'leader' is singularly responsible for performing a state transition.

Change-Id: I0a38db0a56645fc5c0b0fcf2cbd89a3b5f31cebf

[{'created': '2018-04-02 00:43:01.000000000', 'message': 'Complement tests in allocation candidates

In `test_allocation_candidates.py`, there are some tests that
validate `allocation_requests` without checking `provider_summaries`.

This patch complements the tests by adding to the test functions
`_validate_provider_summary_resources`, a base test to check

This change will help us building new features such as nested

Change-Id: Ifa7a21a1f83f4a23747d1c6316d9bffcf158ff9a
'}, {'created': '2018-04-03 07:08:24.000000000', 'message': 'Complement tests in allocation candidates

This patch complements the tests by adding to the test functions
`_validate_provider_summary_resources`, a base test to check

commit_message:
Complement tests in allocation candidates

In `test_allocation_candidates.py`, there are some tests that
validate `allocation_requests` without checking `provider_summaries`.

This patch complements the tests by adding to the test functions
`_validate_provider_summary_resources`, a base test to check
what is in `provider_summaries`.

This change will help us build new features such as nested and
shared providers without breaking the existing behavior.

Change-Id: Ifa7a21a1f83f4a23747d1c6316d9bffcf158ff9a

commit_message:
use neutron-lib servicetype api def

The service type extension's API definition was rehomed into neutron-lib
with commit I301f74d09eb4c0f1d8a0e065403da59e222b78e3

This patch consumes it by removing the rehomed code in neutron and using
the def from neutron-lib.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I30659530c557426fbf4da6cc60892345f3be006e

commit_message:
use multiprovidernet api definition from neutron-lib

The multiprovidernet API extension's definition was rehomed into
neutron-lib with commit If3367e6a14074a6225bba527e8f7e38c51280f85
This patch consumes it by:
- Using the APIExtensionDescriptor and API definition for the extension.
- Removing the rehomed (now duplicated) code from neutron.
- Using lib's code were applicable.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I12c15c360f8bf5a45fbe70e5ed1202ef0e7ec0f0

bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds

sahara-dashboard specific changes:
- sahara-dashboard uses django.urls module which is only available in
  Django 1.11 or later, so the Django min version needs to be bumped to 1.11.

- django-babel needs to bumped to 0.6.2 to support Django 1.11 and 2.0.
- nose-exclude needs to bumped to 0.5.0 to run all existing unit tests.

https://review.openstack.org/555402 allows us to bump lower requirements.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

---
sahara-dashboard specific changes:
- sahara-dashboard uses django.urls module which is only available in
  Django 1.11 or later, so the Django min version needs to be bumped to 1.11.
  Horizon Rocky bumped the Django min version
  to >=1.11
- django-babel needs to bumped to 0.6.2 to support Django 1.11 and 2.0.
- nose-exclude needs to bumped to 0.5.0 to run all existing unit tests.

https://review.openstack.org/555402 allows us to bump lower requirements.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I6cc5d973ea0e586e6fbe2ab4ba1345857722d008
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555402
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Generate user passwords with special characters

When we create user accounts in order to allow signalling back to Heat,
generate the passwords using a mix of upper- and lower-case letters, digits
and special characters. This should pass most password_regex filters that
users are likely to configure in Keystone, which was not true of the
previous method (using only hex characters from a UUID).

Change-Id: I7702d6ab550e4f1f53c4cea9f67ed0402afbd66d
Closes-Bug: #1666129
Closes-Bug: #1444429
(cherry picked from commit 61412548aef0912b621861d08743821439172c6a)

subject: Fix entropy problems with OS::Random::String
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-03-23 16:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 16:41:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix entropy problems with OS::Random::String

When generating a random string, once we had selected from the various
required pools, we continued by selecting a pool at random and then
selecting a character from that pool at random. This did not take into
account the differing sizes of the available pools, nor the fact that the
same character could appear in multiple pools, which resulted in a
non-uniform probability distribution of characters. Since users mostly make
use of this feature to generate default passwords for services they are
deploying, this would result in the generated passwords having slightly
less entropy than expected (and pathological cases were possible).

Rectify this by always selecting non-constrained characters from a single
combined pool, and by ensuring that each character appears only once in any
pool we're selecting from.

Since we also want to use this method to generate passwords for OpenStack
Users, the new implementation is in a separate module in heat.common rather
than mixed in with the resource's logic. Also, use a StringIO object to
collect the characters rather than repeatedly appending to a string.

Change-Id: Ia7b63e72c1e3c0649290caf4fea8a32f7f89560b
Closes-Bug: #1757300
Related-Bug: #1666129
Related-Bug: #1444429
(cherry picked from commit 6e16c051ba9c2fc409c82fda19467d9ee1aaf484)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix entropy problems with OS::Random::String

When generating a random string, once we had selected from the various
required pools, we continued by selecting a pool at random and then
selecting a character from that pool at random. This did not take into
account the differing sizes of the available pools, nor the fact that the
same character could appear in multiple pools, which resulted in a
non-uniform probability distribution of characters. Since users mostly make
use of this feature to generate default passwords for services they are
deploying, this would result in the generated passwords having slightly
less entropy than expected (and pathological cases were possible).

Rectify this by always selecting non-constrained characters from a single
combined pool, and by ensuring that each character appears only once in any
pool we're selecting from.

Since we also want to use this method to generate passwords for OpenStack
Users, the new implementation is in a separate module in heat.common rather
than mixed in with the resource's logic. Also, use a StringIO object to
collect the characters rather than repeatedly appending to a string.

Change-Id: Ia7b63e72c1e3c0649290caf4fea8a32f7f89560b
Closes-Bug: #1757300
Related-Bug: #1666129
Related-Bug: #1444429
(cherry picked from commit 6e16c051ba9c2fc409c82fda19467d9ee1aaf484)

commit_message:
zaqar: align configuration with instack-undercloud

Align zaqar.conf from when deployed with instack-undercloud to THT with
a containerized undercloud, so we obtain the same configuration as
before, therefore the same deployment without feature regression.

Change-Id: I1934d3e9ecee50ddfa9197730f7abbb7a0975874

commit_message:
Silently continue when destroying missing vNIC

At the moment, if requested to destroy an inexistent VM NIC,
os-win will raise an IndexError, which is not really helpful.

In quite a few other cases, we're silently continuing when dealing
with missing resources. We'll do the same here as well.

(cherry-picked from commit 340abb40099eb1a7c2521e5473393cad75e4465f)

Change-Id: Ibe290ba2521a808f3dba150de33f9be0b3519e7c
Related-Bug: #1724282

subject: Fix fetching vm boot sources
messages: [{'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:15:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-04 15:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-04 15:09:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 08:15:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix fetching vm boot sources

When setting the VM disk boot order, we're passing Msvm_DiskDrive
WMI object paths in case of passthrough disks and the actual image
file paths in case of vhd/x images.

In order to determine the disk type, os-win checks if the path is
an existing file path (using os.path.exist), which is extremely
inefficient. The call can take up to a minute in case of a
passthrough disk.

This patch updates the logic so that we're checking if the provided
path resembles a Msvm_DiskDrive WMI object path. The
'_is_drive_physical' method is removed due to its limited scope.

Change-Id: I0fc7a8b5f1feabe07fc1707d8469b929b3739a1d
Closes-Bug: #1723448
"}, {'created': '2018-04-04 15:09:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix fetching vm boot sources

When setting the VM disk boot order, we're passing Msvm_DiskDrive
WMI object paths in case of passthrough disks and the actual image
file paths in case of vhd/x images.

In order to determine the disk type, os-win checks if the path is
an existing file path (using os.path.exist), which is extremely
inefficient. The call can take up to a minute in case of a
passthrough disk.

This patch updates the logic so that we're checking if the provided
path resembles a Msvm_DiskDrive WMI object path. The
'_is_drive_physical' method is removed due to its limited scope.

(cherry-picked from commit 7af8caeb5e79197656133ad28368e1012227675d)

Change-Id: I0fc7a8b5f1feabe07fc1707d8469b929b3739a1d
Closes-Bug: #1723448
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fetching vm boot sources

When setting the VM disk boot order, we're passing Msvm_DiskDrive
WMI object paths in case of passthrough disks and the actual image
file paths in case of vhd/x images.

In order to determine the disk type, os-win checks if the path is
an existing file path (using os.path.exist), which is extremely
inefficient. The call can take up to a minute in case of a
passthrough disk.

This patch updates the logic so that we're checking if the provided
path resembles a Msvm_DiskDrive WMI object path. The
'_is_drive_physical' method is removed due to its limited scope.

(cherry-picked from commit 7af8caeb5e79197656133ad28368e1012227675d)

Change-Id: I0fc7a8b5f1feabe07fc1707d8469b929b3739a1d
Closes-Bug: #1723448

commit_message:
Make Validation actions use startWorkflow

This patch makes runValidation use startWorkflow wrapper to properly
handle it's execution. This change makes handling validations much
simpler as there is no specific onFinished callback needed as validations
only operate on incoming workflow executions which is handled by
WorkflowActions by default.

To properly distinguish between start validation and finished validation
messages (which use the same type) additional logic to zaqar action
was added.

runValidationGroups action remains the same as we handle validations
individually

Partial-Bug: #1753474
Change-Id: Ie0f2f1c5175ca8b87fe7ed672548bc9c59865ae0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-05 13:01:02.000000000', 'message': 'Make running workflows more robust

Currently there is no fallback in case when Zaqar message does not
arrive to inform about the status of ongoing Mistral workflow.

This change introduces mechanism to make execution of workflows more
robust in TripleO UI:

Workflows should be triggered using startWorkflow action - startWorkflow
starts polling for workflow execution after a timeout expires and polls
until workflow execution is finished. Then it executes a callback (usually
action dispatch)

In case a relevant Zaqar message arrives, handleMessage action is triggered
which cancels the timeout, fetches the execution and passes it to callback.

Benefits:
* Application always gets to the result of a workflow execution, regardless
  whether the Zaqar message arrives or not
* Application does not depend on Zaqar message containing relevant data.
  Message is only required to deliver the execution ID, which is then used
  to fetch execution separately
* All executions are tracked in application state

Partial-Bug: #1753474
Change-Id: I2ae26986e5c2e8870238a287fbd3df46a92ed65f

commit_message:
Make running workflows more robust

Currently there is no fallback in case when Zaqar message does not
arrive to inform about the status of ongoing Mistral workflow.

This change introduces mechanism to make execution of workflows more
robust in TripleO UI:

Workflows should be triggered using startWorkflow action - startWorkflow
starts polling for workflow execution after a timeout expires and polls
until workflow execution is finished. Then it executes a callback (usually
action dispatch)

In case a relevant Zaqar message arrives, handleMessage action is triggered
which cancels the timeout, fetches the execution and passes it to callback.

Benefits:
* Application always gets to the result of a workflow execution, regardless
  whether the Zaqar message arrives or not
* Application does not depend on Zaqar message containing relevant data.
  Message is only required to deliver the execution ID, which is then used
  to fetch execution separately
* All executions are tracked in application state

Partial-Bug: #1753474
Change-Id: I2ae26986e5c2e8870238a287fbd3df46a92ed65f

commit_message:
[HAProxy] Allow extra options to be specified per listener

This commit provides operators with the ability to specify additional
options per HTTP or TCP listener stanza.

Change-Id: I66cc5372f2a686213b6748a8260cfe84f789ad8e

commit_message:
Cleanup migration files

At the moment, if an instance migration/resize fails and is deleted
while being in error state, the instance revert files are not deleted.

This change fixes this issue, ensuring that instance migration files
are cleaned up when an instance is destroyed.

(cherry-picked from commit 24cc1f3fffd9e9bdc07b15ab6597c87c9669ee3b)

Closes-Bug: #1724240

Change-Id: I3752e7d0bd96a7d418563afd997739e88a87914d

subject: hyper-v: Logs tips on PortBindingFailed
messages: [{'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-04 08:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-04 15:11:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-04-04 15:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 08:22:33.000000000', 'message': 'hyper-v: Logs tips on PortBindingFailed

When spawning an Hyper-V instance with NICs having the vif_type "hyperv",
neutron will fail to bind the port to the Hyper-V host if the neutron
server doesn't have the "hyperv" mechanism driver installed and configured,
resulting in a PortBindingFailed exception on the nova-compute side.

When this exception is encountered, the logs will say to check the
neutron-server logs, but the problem and its solution are not obvious
or clear, resulting in plenty of questions / reports, all having the
same solution: is there an L2 agent on the host alive and reporting to
neutron, and if neutron Hyper-V agent is used, make sure to install
networking-hyperv and configure neutron-server to use the "hyperv"
mechanism_driver.

Change-Id: I94ed8f15f3c6312a6f675b9255aff7e9d76f96fc
Closes-Bug: #1744032
'}, {'created': '2018-04-04 15:11:50.000000000', 'message': 'hyper-v: Logs tips on PortBindingFailed

When spawning an Hyper-V instance with NICs having the vif_type "hyperv",
neutron will fail to bind the port to the Hyper-V host if the neutron
server doesn't have the "hyperv" mechanism driver installed and configured,
resulting in a PortBindingFailed exception on the nova-compute side.

When this exception is encountered, the logs will say to check the
neutron-server logs, but the problem and its solution are not obvious
or clear, resulting in plenty of questions / reports, all having the
same solution: is there an L2 agent on the host alive and reporting to
neutron, and if neutron Hyper-V agent is used, make sure to install
networking-hyperv and configure neutron-server to use the "hyperv"
mechanism_driver.

(cherry-picked from commit d4fa1d7da15a1c9c69a81365e34c8d94ebd070a2)

Change-Id: I94ed8f15f3c6312a6f675b9255aff7e9d76f96fc
Closes-Bug: #1744032
'}]
commit_message:
hyper-v: Logs tips on PortBindingFailed

When spawning an Hyper-V instance with NICs having the vif_type "hyperv",
neutron will fail to bind the port to the Hyper-V host if the neutron
server doesn't have the "hyperv" mechanism driver installed and configured,
resulting in a PortBindingFailed exception on the nova-compute side.

When this exception is encountered, the logs will say to check the
neutron-server logs, but the problem and its solution are not obvious
or clear, resulting in plenty of questions / reports, all having the
same solution: is there an L2 agent on the host alive and reporting to
neutron, and if neutron Hyper-V agent is used, make sure to install
networking-hyperv and configure neutron-server to use the "hyperv"
mechanism_driver.

(cherry-picked from commit d4fa1d7da15a1c9c69a81365e34c8d94ebd070a2)

Change-Id: I94ed8f15f3c6312a6f675b9255aff7e9d76f96fc
Closes-Bug: #1744032

commit_message:
Improve WMI jobs logging

This change provides additional log information when handling WMI
jobs. This allows us to get a better picture of the job states.

This will be extremely helpful for debugging purposes, as currently
we don't get much information about pending jobs or errors that
occur when stopping jobs.

(cherry-picked from commit 58509209b963dd14a217bbfa5b81b1583980c881)

Closes-Bug: #1748208

Change-Id: Ibb4d5969eea13a0b11a6d5b46b797482a6d2a20b

commit_message:
Fix bindep platform declaration

Bindep takes a list of platform identifiers and profile names.
Each platform needs to be prepended with "platform:" to mark
it as such, with any other stand alone word being interpreted
as a profile name.

This fixes and error where we tried listing multiple platforms
in one tag.

commit_message:
Resolve get_dns_view error after selecting multi-tenant view

Adds a second comparison check when deciding whether to display the single
tenant view or multi-tenant view in Infoblox. The issue is that the DB field
is set to '0', which is not interpreted as false.

Change-Id: Id0fac71cc6d82123a7ee5d5983467acd1b8e5a9e
Closes-Bug: 1752349
(cherry picked from commit e4de365775c1f6f2722f2ad3109f3349d9a5a691)

commit_message:
Docs: Elaborate on feature flag in HACKING file

This is to elaborate on feature flag functionality in Tempest's
HACKING.rst. Currently, there isn't much documentation on feature
flags in Tempest or how to add them. The only place feature
flag is mentioned is in this file. Since testtools.skip(Unless|If)
is a common way of using a feature flag, it is mentioned. Also,
Tempest's interaction with DevStack is an important thing to mention
when explaining how to introduce a new feature flag.

Change-Id: Ia47132fa596918e58f21ba9810c2c28ddcf0d584

subject: Update parameter names in microversion sdk spec
messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Makes sense to me. Thanks for the explanation.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:56:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't quite like it. I would prefer that major version was taken from the first component. But I was told my Monty that a major version can consist of two numbers (glance 2.8), so it won't work.

This is bad and I feel bad about it. But I still think we should stop promoting the word "microversion". It makes sense to very few people. I finally understood its background only in Dublin.

Should we finally pick a better name for it? I would propose to avoid "version" completely, and call it "revision" or "api_revision".'}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-03-30 01:51:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This is the right thing to do.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-04 15:18:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm trying to force myself to think as someone not already familiar with microversions and it's making me wonder if we're doing this all wrong: there's no difference between a version and a microversion, it's all just versions.

What a microversion is is an excuse and commitment to make changes frequently while continuing to allow the old versions to be used.

So major versions, if more than one is present, are sort of like microversions.

Of course this falls down when we try to choose which version is being used. Majors are usually done on URIs, micros on headers.

Not sure what that all means, I'm mostly rambling, but where I think I'm ending up is that major version discovery is the problem, not microversions. I probably say this because placement doesn't have major versions and familiarity breeds makes the heart grow fonder."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 16:46:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update parameter names in microversion sdk spec

keystoneauth/openstacksdk already basically support what the spec calls
for (other than a list of default microversions) However, they use
different option names than what here.

Although the examples are examples, it's quite likley people
implementing things will follow the naming.

Because of version discovery, the words "api_version", "min_version" and
"max_version" all carry meaning referring to finding major versions.
(For instance, shade supports v2 and v3 of cinder, and so creates the
keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter instance with min_version=2, max_version=3
and keystoneauth gets the latest available major version endpoint)

So that things aren't confusing, the parameter names "microversion" and
"default_microversion" were chosen. microversion is given on a per-call
basis. default_microversion is given to a constructor.

Update the examples to use terms that match keystoneauth/openstacksdk.

Change-Id: If10f552477c97a9fd234423c673cab86be3f2981
'}]
commit_message:
Update parameter names in microversion sdk spec

keystoneauth/openstacksdk already basically support what the spec calls
for (other than a list of default microversions) However, they use
different option names than what here.

Although the examples are examples, it's quite likley people
implementing things will follow the naming.

Because of version discovery, the words "api_version", "min_version" and
"max_version" all carry meaning referring to finding major versions.
(For instance, shade supports v2 and v3 of cinder, and so creates the
keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter instance with min_version=2, max_version=3
and keystoneauth gets the latest available major version endpoint)

So that things aren't confusing, the parameter names "microversion" and
"default_microversion" were chosen. microversion is given on a per-call
basis. default_microversion is given to a constructor.

Update the examples to use terms that match keystoneauth/openstacksdk.

Change-Id: If10f552477c97a9fd234423c673cab86be3f2981

commit_message:
Ensures that all classes have the same interface as their parents

VMUtils10 has a few extra methods when compared to VMUtils. This
patch adds those methods to VMUtils (raising NotImplementedError).

Adds unit test that checks for future inconsistentcies.

ISCSIInitiatorCLIUtils has been deprecated and removed, but it was
not removed from utilsfactory.utils_map. This patch addresses this
issue.

(cherry-picked from commit ea65d0a5105d0a1e258cd26f653fef91b6336746)

Closes-Bug: #1746986

Change-Id: I2a963304fc67595bc18e719e6b4420f553519c41

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 12:15:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'rally task report --tasks'

The argument `--tasks` of `rally task report` is deprecated from Rally 0.10.
Unfortunately, the wrong destination was used, so `--tasks` argument stopped
working.

This patch fixes destination for `--tasks` argument. As well, this patch
improves the deprecation warning message to include an alternative
argument if presents (currently alternative argument is displayed only
in help message).

Change-Id: I45750027ddc1f39fc362b1d776f847707c8e7d67
"}, {'created': '2018-04-03 12:15:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'rally task report --tasks'

The argument `--tasks` of `rally task report` is deprecated from Rally 0.10.
Unfortunately, the wrong destination was used, so `--tasks` argument stopped
working.

This patch fixes destination for `--tasks` argument. As well, this patch
improves the deprecation warning message to include an alternative
argument if presents (currently alternative argument is displayed only
in help message).

Change-Id: I45750027ddc1f39fc362b1d776f847707c8e7d67
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'rally task report --tasks'

The argument `--tasks` of `rally task report` is deprecated from Rally 0.10.
Unfortunately, the wrong destination was used, so `--tasks` argument stopped
working.

This patch fixes destination for `--tasks` argument. As well, this patch
improves the deprecation warning message to include an alternative
argument if presents (currently alternative argument is displayed only
in help message).

Change-Id: I45750027ddc1f39fc362b1d776f847707c8e7d67

commit_message:
Defaults to parent_resource name correctly

When name attribute of deployment is an empty
string, dict.get will return that empty string
instead of returning the default value set in
the second param of dict.get(first, second).
This patch fixes it by returning the default
value.

Change-Id: I7b48414fd18e01594f6d9b0d106c2abb71b7f676
Related-Bug: #1755078

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 21:31:07.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1] . But it still used in a few places, non-deprecated LOG.warning should be used instead.

Note: If we are using logger from oslo.log, warn is still valid [2], but I agree we can switch to LOG.warning.

[1]https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
[2]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/master/oslo_log/log.py#L85

Change-Id: Ibbcc287815cbc06162a13448c2dabcb0748e4e32
Closes-Bug: #1508442
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1] . But it still used in a few places, non-deprecated LOG.warning should be used instead.

Note: If we are using logger from oslo.log, warn is still valid [2], but I agree we can switch to LOG.warning.

[1]https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
[2]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/master/oslo_log/log.py#L85

Change-Id: Ibbcc287815cbc06162a13448c2dabcb0748e4e32
Closes-Bug: #1508442

'}, {'created': '2018-02-01 01:03:26.000000000', 'message': 'Cache barbican certs for periodic tasks

Added configuration parameter, temp_cache_dir, to magnum.conf with
default value of "/var/lib/magnum/certificate-cache". This local
directory will hold cached cluster TLS credentials that are generated
during periodic tasks, to reduce load as the number of clusters
increases.

Closes-Bug: #1659545

commit_message:
Cache barbican certs for periodic tasks

Added configuration parameter, temp_cache_dir, to magnum.conf with
default value of "/var/lib/magnum/certificate-cache". This local
directory will hold cached cluster TLS credentials that are generated
during periodic tasks, to reduce load as the number of clusters
increases. If the temp_cache_dir does not exist, the certificates
will be created as tempfiles.

Closes-Bug: #1659545

Change-Id: I8808c4098a7c8d22dbfc841142c9f9c8b976dde1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 10:35:05.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.
This patch makes it self maintaining. Note that due to the fact
that RDO/SUSE do not implement their repositories for a new
release until much, much later in the cycle, we use the previous
release repo for master. This will self-update during our RC
when the stable branch is cut.

Some formatting adjustments have made to prevent the interpretation
of URL's as links by sphinx and to remove the use of multi-line shell
commands.

Closes-Bug: #1759721
Change-Id: Id28540d335390a52e0eb65a734a1d594235265d6

commit_message:
Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.
This patch makes it self maintaining.

Note that due to the fact that this is a stable branch and that
the documentation configuration is vastly different to master,
this is a re-implementation rather than a backport.

Some formatting adjustments have made to prevent the interpretation
of URL's as links by sphinx and to remove the use of multi-line shell
commands.

Closes-Bug: #1759721
Change-Id: Id28540d335390a52e0eb65a734a1d594235265d6

commit_message:
Introduce Gnocchi metric service

This patch is based on [1] and introduces the metric service which will
be used by Gnocchi scenarios in further patches.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/453861/

Co-Authored-By: akrzos <akrzos@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id03ab5692401298ec77313db1ab65bb16498aa6b
Signed-off-by: Juha Kosonen <juha.kosonen@nokia.com>

subject: Use UDID on vscsi mappings
messages:
[{'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-04-04 14:10:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-04 14:17:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This looks fine superficially.  Need to make sure we get some live test to exercise this specific code path, though, since our CI doesn't hit it.  UDIDs can be tricksy.

And while we're at it, may as well enhance the UT to exercise this path, cause it clearly ain't at the moment."}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-04-04 14:41:01.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

turns out we don't need this for traditional VIOS, and we will need a lot more work to support FC vSCSI on Linux VIOS, so this isn't really important enough to put in test effort right now."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 14:10:27.000000000', 'message': "Use UDID on vscsi mappings

We have been passing udid to _add_append_mapping for iscsi but not
for vscsi. We know the udid for vscsi as well, so it's easy to pass
it. This may help resolve name conflicts or may have no effect, but
should not hurt.

Change-Id: I7a3c0576208dde3e32ecc7b27def2e2e7c401560
"}]
commit_message:
Use UDID on vscsi mappings

We have been passing udid to _add_append_mapping for iscsi but not
for vscsi. We know the udid for vscsi as well, so it's easy to pass
it. This may help resolve name conflicts or may have no effect, but
should not hurt.

Change-Id: I7a3c0576208dde3e32ecc7b27def2e2e7c401560

subject: Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints
messages: [{'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:12:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-04 14:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 13:12:22.000000000', 'message': "Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints

If this role is run without having pip_install_upper_constraints set
then you'll get a failure stating that pip_install_upper_constraints is
undefined.

This patch simply adds the default filter when referencing
pip_install_upper_constraints, which seems to be the pattern used in
openstack-ansible's utility-install.yml playbook.

Change-Id: If1b68fb21e0eb8f2f8c33a6bec952c2972e3e5e3
(cherry picked from commit 5a99262155f8b6766ec893fc57854a5b2198f495)
"}]
commit_message:
Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints

If this role is run without having pip_install_upper_constraints set
then you'll get a failure stating that pip_install_upper_constraints is
undefined.

This patch simply adds the default filter when referencing
pip_install_upper_constraints, which seems to be the pattern used in
openstack-ansible's utility-install.yml playbook.

Change-Id: If1b68fb21e0eb8f2f8c33a6bec952c2972e3e5e3
(cherry picked from commit 5a99262155f8b6766ec893fc57854a5b2198f495)

[{'created': '2017-11-29 17:58:39.000000000', 'message': "Save logs from alternative oslo.messaging backend servers

oslo.messaging has the option of supporting non-rabbitmq backends,
like qpidd, dispatch-router, or kafka (in development). If any of
these backend's log files are present save them when cleaning up the
host.

Change-Id: I9c76058942cc6cb22480621e69e8be2e0763a8af
"}]
commit_message:
Save logs from alternative oslo.messaging backend servers

oslo.messaging has the option of supporting non-rabbitmq backends,
like qpidd, dispatch-router, or kafka (in development). If any of
these backend's log files are present save them when cleaning up the
host.

Change-Id: I9c76058942cc6cb22480621e69e8be2e0763a8af

commit_message:
Fix publishing infra/publications

The two publishing jobs failed, fix them:
* ZUUL_REFNAME in playbooks/publications/run.yaml#n12 is not set, use
  the proper variable.
* index publishing is done from master, always check out master for
  this like it was done for version 2.

Change-Id: I494c69e51282418bbc7cac45454abe8c52e6920f

commit_message:
[rally] Remove several redundant jobs

Rally team moved all OpenStack plugins under separate repository
(openstack/rally-openstack) which has new jobs based on Zuul V3
workflow.

Despite the fact we still want to check deprecated in-tree plugins in
rally repo, we do not need to launch the whole list of them. Let's
decrease cost of CI for Rally project.

Needed-By: Id6bf198cbc8eaa44f682a6465cf6d43809b7fd98

Change-Id: I9f44ebf9ab569a94c5c8690ec3283f9d944fd3fc

Monkey-patch etcd3gw's Watcher to avoid socket leak

Try to duplicate the socket and call shutdown() to forcibly
close the connection.

Change-Id: Ie5c1d286180d0bdb3d38c8e550879c3d36f2c93f

subject: Use constraints with get-pip.py
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 13:10:34.000000000', 'message': "Use constraints with get-pip.py

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/558124
- https://review.openstack.org/558599

Presently no constraints are passed to get-pip.py when installing
pip, so we just receive the latest version of pip/setuptools/wheel
everywhere without respecting global-requirement-pins or any other
constraints.

To avoid this we'll pass pip_install_upper_constraints args to
get-pip.py by default.

Change-Id: I32603fd34b60183607c6bd9653c36432cbe6b07a
"}]
commit_message:
Use constraints with get-pip.py

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/558124
- https://review.openstack.org/558599

Presently no constraints are passed to get-pip.py when installing
pip, so we just receive the latest version of pip/setuptools/wheel
everywhere without respecting global-requirement-pins or any other
constraints.

To avoid this we'll pass pip_install_upper_constraints args to
get-pip.py by default.

Change-Id: I32603fd34b60183607c6bd9653c36432cbe6b07a

subject: Limit neutron_ovs_agent CPU to 15% in CI scenarios
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-21 10:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-21 11:43:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

hm, I'm not sure why, but cpu.shares limits seems not applied over neutron-openvswitch-agent process running in the neutron_ovs_agent container. Even though the latter has it correctly configured and shown right!

cat /sys/fs/cgroup/cpu,cpuacct/system.slice/docker-<neutron_ovs_agent_id>.scope/cpu.shares
150"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-03-21 13:25:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow

that is expected behavior according to the docs https://docs.docker.com/config/containers/resource_constraints/#cpu'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-04-02 20:28:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think we should do this in a ci-specific fashion.  If we want to limit the cpu usage of services we should pick default values that work in production.  Otherwise we run the risk of hiding bugs like this 100% ovs-agent problem.  Evidently limiting the cpu isn't making the failures more obvious since ci passed (other than one job that has since been marked non-voting).  This means we would ignore the problem until it hit production where we don't have these configurations."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:12:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

agree with Ben. we don't want this sort of thing in CI, unless it's a temporary workaround as the cause of the bug is being addressed.

It looks like the neutron bug has been fixed:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1750777

And we've promoted since that merged. Is this even still an issue? Are we using the promoted Neutron with the fix and is it working?
It's not clear if that's the case here or not."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-04-04 14:01:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Ping it if we might want this in the bug scope'}]

'}]
commit_message:
Update to openstack-tox-linters job

tripleo-ipsec is a project with ansible roles, also we want to follow
the same job pattern as other projects do [1], so we want to run
openstack-tox-linters to ensure a good ansible code quality.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/commit/fb5208f53c10ff617b637552d5645a78d0b03954

Change-Id: I12202944da10cacbb9a23dd73169addb086cde29

subject: Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints
messages: [{'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:14:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-04 13:12:03.000000000', 'message': "Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints

If this role is run without having pip_install_upper_constraints set
then you'll get a failure stating that pip_install_upper_constraints is
undefined.

This patch simply adds the default filter when referencing
pip_install_upper_constraints, which seems to be the pattern used in
openstack-ansible's utility-install.yml playbook.

Change-Id: If1b68fb21e0eb8f2f8c33a6bec952c2972e3e5e3
(cherry picked from commit 5a99262155f8b6766ec893fc57854a5b2198f495)
"}]
commit_message:
Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints

If this role is run without having pip_install_upper_constraints set
then you'll get a failure stating that pip_install_upper_constraints is
undefined.

This patch simply adds the default filter when referencing
pip_install_upper_constraints, which seems to be the pattern used in
openstack-ansible's utility-install.yml playbook.

Change-Id: If1b68fb21e0eb8f2f8c33a6bec952c2972e3e5e3
(cherry picked from commit 5a99262155f8b6766ec893fc57854a5b2198f495)

commit_message:
Volume detach should have instance uuid

For multiattach volumes we need the instance uuid to be
passed when volume detach api is called to identify the
correct volume to detach.

Change-Id: I810f3ecb2ca02a39532f21c6830ff93e6a84cb1f

commit_message:
WIP: Enabling DIB for RHEL7 PPC64le

Currently DIB does not completely support the rhel7 ppc64le images.
Adding the support for DIB base rhel7 element for ppc64le.

Change-Id: If4ac26787d07608190d7ea8c8c2ae5ba408953ec
Closes-bug: #bug_1629283

subject: Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints
messages:
[{'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:02:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-04-03 19:53:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-03 20:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't think I understand the problem. The code uses

(pip_install_upper_constraints is defined) |                   ternary('--constraint ' ~ pip_install_upper_constraints, '')

which means that pip_install_upper_constraints will only be used if it's defined. So it should work as is.

Moreover, the "| default('')" option that you add will result in --constrains '' which will lead to failures since you pass an empty string to the --constrains parameter. But as I said this will never happen (and the filter has no effect) if pip_install_upper_constraints is not defined.

So what do I miss?'}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2018-04-03 20:19:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Markos, it looks like ansible still tries to evaluate `ternary('--constraint ' ~ pip_install_upper_constraints, '')` even if pip_install_upper_constraints is not defined?"}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-04-03 20:19:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

it does indeed ^ I tested and confirmed'}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2018-04-03 20:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/718323/ is a dummy playbook to replicate this failure with.'}, {'account_id': 12906, 'date': '2018-04-03 21:12:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Hi Markos, it looks like ansible still tries to evaluate
 > `ternary('--constraint ' ~ pip_install_upper_constraints, '')` even
 > if pip_install_upper_constraints is not defined?

 > Hi Markos, it looks like ansible still tries to evaluate
 > `ternary('--constraint ' ~ pip_install_upper_constraints, '')` even
 > if pip_install_upper_constraints is not defined?

OK thanks. I would prefer if you put that in the commit message to explain that even though "| default('')" looks wrong, it's there to workaround this Ansible behavior. This will prevent us from removing this filter in the future as part of a cleanup'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:31:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Alternatively, and in a simpler manner, this could be done by defining a default in the role to '' and simplifying the conditions, removing the default filter."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-04 10:04:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This matches the pattern used in every role. Given that we're likely to backport this, I would think we should implement improvements to the pattern after this patch - and across all roles. However, given that the way that constraints will be applied is going to change anyway in the python build simplification work, I don't think it's worth the effort to change this pattern right now."}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-04 10:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-04 12:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 08bef3a2e444ff307b2b7c6aab8edd78c4fd9d97'}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2018-04-04 13:12:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 933c00643569b8b5826c4fafd04a01cfd773f7f0'}]

then you'll get a failure stating that pip_install_upper_constraints is

This patch simply adds the default filter when referencing

commit_message:
Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints

If this role is run without having pip_install_upper_constraints set
then you'll get a failure stating that pip_install_upper_constraints is
undefined.

This patch simply adds the default filter when referencing
pip_install_upper_constraints, which seems to be the pattern used in
openstack-ansible's utility-install.yml playbook.

Change-Id: If1b68fb21e0eb8f2f8c33a6bec952c2972e3e5e3

commit_message:
Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap

The requirements.txt contents do not need to be
installed on to the host. The majority of the
requirements are for ansible, or for release
and management tooling which needs to use the
Ansible runtime venv.

Rather than forcing the installation of pip on
the host, we only install virtualenv via distro
packages (where possible). With virtualenv in
place we can create the runtime venv and install
pip, etc and all requirements into there.

Doing this keeps the system python libraries as
clean as possible, preventing clashes with other
packages (eg: ceph) which try to install other
python libraries which conflict on CentOS.

Change-Id: I0db786645c11649764680697518c97ddf9610cfa

commit_message:
Set new parameter in OVS to support ODL Oxygen

ODL oxygen provides a new framework to configure tunnels called autotunnels.
SFC requires tunnels to be flow-based and to arrange that in the autotunnel
framework, the OVS internal parameter of-tunnel must be set to true.

That parameter is not read in previous ODL versions. Therefore, this patch
does not break backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Iec6a741d1e1081da547fe6fc0a67dd723e714d60
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri parameter

Option "auth_uri" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated[1].
Use option "www_authenticate_uri" from group "keystone_authtoken".

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I092efd9c530b3108a88c4f6f364f7b4adbaf6a80
Depends-On: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Closes-Bug: #1759098

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 13:42:31.000000000', 'message': 'Validate scheduling fields in basic ops scenario

Currently there is no validation of node scheduling fields - resource
class and traits - in the scenario tests. This change adds validation of
these fields to the bare metal basic ops test.

We query the flavor used to boot the instance, and extract all requested
resources and traits from extra_specs. These are matched against the
resource class and traits set on the bare metal node that was scheduled.

commit_message:
Validate scheduling fields in basic ops scenario

Currently there is no validation of node scheduling fields - resource
class and traits - in the scenario tests. This change adds validation of
these fields to the bare metal basic ops test.

We query the flavor used to boot the instance, and extract all requested
resources and traits from extra_specs. These are matched against the
resource class and traits set on the bare metal node that was scheduled.

Change-Id: I9ddc895ead61cf02c6967ead094d061cb7f558d8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/545370
Related-Bug: #1722194

commit_message:
Not able to set threshold value to ‘0’ in aodh alarm creation

Aodh alarm creation fails when threshold value is set to '0,
but it can updated to '0'.

Change-Id: Ia780e6cdbea97ffe82d6136ea740a221df30469c
Closes-Bug: #1743990

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 00:10:24.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use update_inventory from the resource tracker

The resource tracker calls the new update_inventory virt driver method -
using it if available, and falling back to the existing
get_inventory-if-available business if it's not implemented - and
flushes the changes back to placement accordingly.

WIP: Currently just saving my place.  I think this is going to get split
into three changes:
- One to implement the new ReportClient.get_provider_tree method.  It
  will retrieve the provider tree associated with this compute node.  If
  it doesn't exist yet, it will create it with a (single, root) provider
  corresponding to the compute node.
- One to define the ComputeDriver.update_inventory method.  That method
  will be allowed to add descendants to the root provider (representing
  the compute node) and add/update inventory on said providers.
- Then this one, which uses the above.

By the way, we still need GET /allocation_candidates affordance for
nested resource providers before we can get serious about all of this.

Change-Id: I5ee11274816cd9e4f0669e9e52468a29262c9020
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

commit_message:
Use update_provider_tree from resource tracker

The resource tracker calls the new update_provider_tree virt driver
method - using it if available, falling back to the existing
get_inventory-if-available business if not - and flushes the changes
back to placement accordingly.

Change-Id: I5ee11274816cd9e4f0669e9e52468a29262c9020
blueprint: update-provider-tree

[{'created': '2017-09-11 18:04:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove win32/nt checks for wrapper script gen

It now appears safe to remove the Windows conditions that skip
executing override_get_script_args() and install_wrapper_scripts().
Having demonstrated that bdist_wheel works, it should now work for

Change-Id: Ic243a3ccd3aee0dcb17d6419bc44271f5ebe5551
Closes-Bug: 1521407

It now appears safe to remove the Windows conditions that skip
executing override_get_script_args() and install_wrapper_scripts().
Having demonstrated that bdist_wheel works, it should now work for

commit_message:
Remove win32/nt checks for wrapper script gen

It now appears safe to remove the Windows conditions that skip
executing override_get_script_args() and install_wrapper_scripts().
Having demonstrated that bdist_wheel works, it should now work for
sdist too, and experiments do indeed appear to bear that out.

Change-Id: Ic243a3ccd3aee0dcb17d6419bc44271f5ebe5551
Closes-Bug: 1521407

commit_message:
Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.
This patch makes it self maintaining. Note that due to the fact
that RDO/SUSE do not implement their repositories for a new
release until much, much later in the cycle, we use the previous
release repo for master. This will self-update during our RC
when the stable branch is cut.

Some formatting adjustments have made to prevent the interpretation
of URL's as links by sphinx and to remove the use of multi-line shell
commands.

Closes-Bug: #1759721
Change-Id: Id28540d335390a52e0eb65a734a1d594235265d6

(2 comments)

Overall I think this is a reasonable plan but I think there are at least two issues:

* From my comment within, I think we need to be more clear on how we are supposed to extract meaning from the error codes and who we establish whether a new one is correct according to those rules

* We can make the spec much less long by instead listing the full response body, making a list or table of request URL, method, response code, error code, and links. That will be easier for the reader to digest. Having a very similar response over and over obscures the important details.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-14 18:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2017-03-14 18:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think this will be easier if you compare it with the error json payloads you get today. Its got quite a lot more info than you might first expect.'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2017-03-15 20:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)

@Chris

1. That was my concern either - using only labels (string error codes) for extracting information about particular error might be somehow vague.
IMHO numerical code would be better for that purpose, just like in Twitter API which Stephen mentioned, since they are explicit in natural way.

2. I guess you're right - in that approach it is pretty easy to get lost in very similar payloads. Question is if it is an acceptable approach, where we have one, generic response body in a form like:


  Content-Type: application/json
  {
    "errors": [
      {
        "code": "placement.[error_code]",
        "status": [http_status],
        "title": "[title]",
        "detail": "[details]",
        "links": [
          {
            "rel": "help",
            "href": "[help_url]"
          }
        ]
      }
    ]
  }

followed by the table, where:

- request endpoint
- http_status
- error_code
- title
- detail
- help_url

would be filled with appropriate values.


@John

In BP[1] there is no JSON errors mentioned in the response. OTOH, in the code[2] response is a plain text which is simply an error text, which origins from exception messages. To recognize what was the cause of 409 error it was needed to check this message (for example [3]) which is unfortunate, since those messages are subject for translation. This might be a cause of issue in case, operator is running localized stack.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/27545305aa78b382e2aa86a54b359d48a6666f46/nova/api/openstack/placement/handlers/allocation.py#L263-L271
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/27545305aa78b382e2aa86a54b359d48a6666f46/nova/scheduler/client/report.py#L540-L546'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2017-03-15 21:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-15 21:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/93/418393/5/check/gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/3c3a7a8/ : SUCCESS in 2m 56s

Maybe it is good to have some PoC code for this proposal, I can't stop to think how to build this in the placement API."}, {'account_id': 6062, 'date': '2017-03-16 08:19:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

seems https://review.openstack.org/307675 can be a follow on of this bp'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-03-16 11:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)

Some issues with the work items.

Also, you might want to track if anything becomes of the work discussed in this email message http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114118.html 

And finally, there's a tricky issue, as Alex suggests, with how to actually implement this. At the moment the placement web framework very intentionally uses plain webob.exc to raise errors (to avoid complexity, code creep and generally keep things simple) and then formats them accordingly. In order to do this the new "code" attribute we'll probably need to either have a mixin or a bunch of subclases that allow a code attribute. I hope that we can do that while maintaining the essential simplicity of the existing system.'}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2017-03-17 08:29:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(4 comments)

@Chris, @Alex,

Thanks for pointing out this particular mail thread. Turns out[1], that translations for log messages will no longer continues, so main point for this BP (examining error message instead of error code) is no longer valid.

My bet here would be to provide this particular json format only for clients, who accepts application/json as the first thing. Second, I would go with new microversion within json_error_formatter function, which would provide new json structure. Matching particular error with a new error code is indeed tricky thing. I'm going to submit POC with possible solution soon, so we can figure out what would be the best approach here.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446452"}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2017-03-17 13:43:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-03-17 13:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

- gate-nova-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/93/418393/7/check/gate-nova-specs-docs-ubuntu-xenial/390ba6f//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 33s
- gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/93/418393/7/check/gate-nova-specs-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/bd3ca50/ : SUCCESS in 2m 27s
- gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/93/418393/7/check/gate-nova-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/a32b9ad/ : SUCCESS in 3m 16s'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2017-03-17 14:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Chris, I thought the new "code" attribute shouldn't be part of web.exc.*. The exception of "web.exc.*'" already very generic exception. For the specific code, that should be part of the exceptions which are currently in "nova/exception.py".'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-03-17 14:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> @Chris, I thought the new "code" attribute shouldn't be part of
 > web.exc.*. The exception of "web.exc.*'" already very generic
 > exception. For the specific code, that should be part of the
 > exceptions which are currently in "nova/exception.py".

In the API layer we don't expose anything other webob.exc style exceptions. When there are exceptions raised in objects/resource_provider.py we catch them in the individual handlers and turn them into HTTP exceptions. It is those exception that contain and produce the structure JSON responses.

There is one exception to that rule: there are a number of places where we let a nova.exception.NotFound rise to be caught in handler.py.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-07-10 22:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-07-10 22:18:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I've moved this to queens and made the explanation of the change less verbose/complete."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-07-10 23:27:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-11 02:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

Thanks Eric, response within. We can (and probably should) punt on resolving this stuff until after feature freeze, but useful to think about in the back of our brains.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2017-07-11 16:28:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Thanks for the response cdent.  Makes a bunch of sense.  Some more thoughts inline.  But agree there's no need to go crazy nailing this down right now."}, {'account_id': 13692, 'date': '2017-07-25 16:17:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

Here is the explanation why I'd put some help links in the response…"}, {'account_id': 23942, 'date': '2017-09-17 20:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I like the idea of having unique ID for different error reasons.

The link section would only make sense if there would be a well maintained documentation. Such large effort outweighs benefits.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-09-25 14:31:30.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Abandoning this for Queens. We don't have an owner and this is lower priority, and we already have a pretty full list of things to do for Queens already."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-20 16:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-02-20 17:34:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-20 17:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-02-20 17:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-02-20 18:40:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

commit_message:
Provide error codes for placement API

This blueprint describes a framework for providing additional
information in case of error when making requests of the placement API.
This information can be used on the client side to distinguish what
caused an error in the event of the same HTTP response code.

This is a re-proposal of a spec originally proposed to Queens. The main
changes are:

* It removes the requirement to implement the help link, suggesting
  we do that later.
* It adjusts the emphasis to being development of a framework rather
  than a complete overhaul of existing responses.
* Add links to:
    * a WIP of how to do it
    * placement api-ref
* Makes some comments in the Alternatives section about how we may
  wish to address microversions.

blueprint placement-api-error-handling
Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Change-Id: Id644f9f509ab382afe155cca0babf08a53d66338

commit_message:
Fix endpoint URI /allocation_requests

This patch updates the spec to get consistent with the implementation
changing the URI /allocation_requests to /allocation_candidates.

Change-Id: I3883607ffc1cb58b2d01a56e9655f54aa97f416d
Blueprint: placement-allocation-requests

commit_message:
Continue to work on adding an asterisk on the network address field of subnet create

The Network Address field in the Create Subnet workflow (Subnet tab) is missing an asterisk.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to Admin -> Networks
2. Click on a Network
3. Click Create Subnet
4. Attempt to create the subnet without filling in the Network Address field.

The error message is at the top of the form, when it should be by the field, and the Network Address field itself is missing an asterisk.

Closes Bug: #1420370

Change-Id: I8b34ad8ac7c140885a658c9a5aff5de5c3f35e9c

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I09095ca8bb36420f77cd2e372d7b478f28930fc8
Depends-On: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Closes-Bug: #1759098

commit_message:
Services: Add support for K8S service's port edit use case

Kubernetes supports edit operation for API resources.
This patch extends service handler to support edit operation
of  K8S service's port field.

Change-Id: I286dd8a1383de8eda78637d455e6f8035f178c02
Closes-Bug: 1684096
(cherry picked from commit 677c38b2a6e6c18c251a7b20f2607283c7e831f1)

commit_message:
Use neutron.default_quota_get to get default quotas for neutron

According to https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1204956,
Neutron provide the API to get default quotas.
This patch use this api for more readable code.

Change-Id: I6965ba88d53e04b16a0d5d21211244d4f4551918

commit_message:
fix lower constraints to match requirements

Today our requirements check build has been failing [1][2] because
what's specified in our lower-constraints.txt doesn't match what's
in our requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt.

This patch updates lower-constraints to match.
For additional details see the discussion started in [3].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/38/553838/4/check/requirements-check/
74b56de/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-03_18_13_35_389665
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/38/553838/3/check/requirements-check/
b25a52f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-03_15_02_38_526227
[3] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/
%23openstack-infra.2018-04-03.log.html#t2018-04-03T17:57:50

Correction of chinese translation

"Availability Zone =" not translation in the dashboard view /dashboard/project/instances/ dropdown menu index 10.

In all other places "Availability Zone" translate into "KeYongYu",so correction it according.

Change-Id: I506e1bb7216e087bbe1f093c44ecb55b90e25fbd

Prefix the project description with RETIRED for retired projects

Prefix the project description with RETIRED for retired projects
and removed now obsolete groups, use-storyboard and docimpact
settings as well.

commit_message:

This patch adds a note to show that
depending on the MySQL version used
the configuration file can be called
differently.

[{'created': '2018-03-21 10:46:53.000000000', 'message': 'Do not create NetworkVlanID is the value is not defined

In case of Upgrade, the {{role}}NetworkVlanID is not defined
in network_data.yaml in Pike.
So when the jinja template generate the network_data.yaml
the parameter_defaults for the NetworkVlanID result to
empty parameters.
If no VlanID has been provided by user environment files,
then we need to used the default defined in network/config/

Change-Id: If119f3900eb60a217b8209d59fb9bc900107addb
'}]
commit_message:
Do not create NetworkVlanID is the value is not defined

In case of Upgrade, the {{role}}NetworkVlanID is not defined
in network_data.yaml in Pike.
So when the jinja template generate the network_data.yaml
the parameter_defaults for the NetworkVlanID result to
empty parameters.
If no VlanID has been provided by user environment files,
then we need to used the default defined in network/config/

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 18:29:31.000000000', 'message': "ignore location when comparing options for duplicate registration

Before this change, two options that were identical except for the
location in the code where the Opt class was instantiated or how they
were initialized (the default, set_override, etc.) would compare as
not being equal. The result is that consumers of oslo.config that
include multiple definitions of the same option but in different files
would report an error for a duplicate option. The error may also be
triggered by using set_override() and re-registering an option under
some circumstances.

This patch ensures that the location where the option's value is set
does not factor into the equality check for the option.

Change-Id: I0c57f92c28f220009e01cfe641ec14039c51f671
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ignore location when comparing options for duplicate registration

Before this change, two options that were identical except for the
location in the code where the Opt class was instantiated or how they
were initialized (the default, set_override, etc.) would compare as
not being equal. The result is that consumers of oslo.config that
include multiple definitions of the same option but in different files
would report an error for a duplicate option. The error may also be
triggered by using set_override() and re-registering an option under
some circumstances.

This patch ensures that the location where the option's value is set
does not factor into the equality check for the option.

Change-Id: I0c57f92c28f220009e01cfe641ec14039c51f671
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
