[{'created': '2018-03-30 19:22:25.000000000', 'message': "Disable developer mode for tempest role tests

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Also, given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: Ibc191f6fc33ca9a1807c01a23f476c4dfe225f33

commit_message:
Disable developer mode for tempest role tests

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/557720
- https://review.openstack.org/558524

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Also, given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: Ibc191f6fc33ca9a1807c01a23f476c4dfe225f33

commit_message:
Do not generate the html ARA report any more

In order to ensure a clean pick, this is a
combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/550956
- https://review.openstack.org/557921

With [1] we no longer need to generate the html report,
so in this patch we change the log collection process
in order to use the new mechanism.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128902.html

Change-Id: Ic05ac14ef8bc2f67c40f6d5356edbff32f5e6c5c

commit_message:
Do not generate the html ARA report any more

In order to ensure a clean pick, this is a
combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/550956
- https://review.openstack.org/557921

With [1] we no longer need to generate the html report,
so in this patch we change the log collection process
in order to use the new mechanism.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128902.html

Change-Id: Ic05ac14ef8bc2f67c40f6d5356edbff32f5e6c5c

commit_message:
Add a documentation list default

This change adds the documentation list default to our systemd service
files when populated. This is feature will provide us the ability to
link services to specific documentation which operators will be able to
see when querying a service.

Change-Id: I514d907ccbb52cc6010a29c4c3e10eb2cf558dfa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Fix some issues due to dnsmasq
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 19578, 'name': 'Olivier Bourdon', 'email': 'olivierbourdon38@gmail.com', 'username': 'olivierbourdon38'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22474, 'name': 'OPNFV CI', 'email': 'opnfvci@gmail.com', 'username': 'opnfvci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23163, 'name': 'Markos Chandras (hwoarang)', 'email': 'markos@chandras.me', 'username': 'mchandras'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-03 16:05:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The situation can be magically resolved and also improve the overall performance by simply improving the 

tasks/install.yml task to use

package:
  name: "{{ required_packages }}"
  state: present

since the package module can accept an entire list as an argument. This also installs all the packages at once instead of installing them one by one'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-04-03 16:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@markos, this is also what I was thinking but may be there are good reasons (unknown to me) which prevented to do so and keep the code as it is. @TheJulia and other bifrosters could you please comment on this'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-03 16:26:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> @markos, this is also what I was thinking but may be there are good
 > reasons (unknown to me) which prevented to do so and keep the code
 > as it is. @TheJulia and other bifrosters could you please comment
 > on this

My guess is that the package module couldn't handle lists in the past when this role was originally written."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-04-03 22:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

So.... a couple things.

1) The reason for dnsmasq to be last was due to the install script in some packages initiating an update of dns settings when additional packages were needed.
2) AFAIK, no options exist to prevent that post-install script from running.
3) The reason for the list is to help enforce the behavior. I think we could provide them all in once when we wrote the role, but opted for the sequential nature in order to best control the flow of installation. Not that it really matters in most cases.

Tl;dr I’m good with this change. I’m not aware of why the patch is being proposed, but likely it is the same exact issue that caused me to put the entry into the install script originally.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-04-04 06:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Many thanks for this confirmation Julia'}, {'account_id': 6133, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 15:56:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix some issues due to dnsmasq

As already suggested by TheJulia in the Debian family files, the installation
of dnsmasq package can lead to DNS issues which can prevent packages further
down the list to be properly installed

Change-Id: I81cd58c7c9cd4c22dbd3f08ba9a7dfea842e7d2d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix some issues due to dnsmasq

As already suggested by TheJulia in the Debian family files, the installation
of dnsmasq package can lead to DNS issues which can prevent packages further
down the list to be properly installed

Change-Id: I81cd58c7c9cd4c22dbd3f08ba9a7dfea842e7d2d

subject: Fix of masakari command for upcoming openstacksdk changes
messages:
[{'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-02-26 02:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-02-28 07:27:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-03-01 02:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-03-12 17:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Trying to patch and test it out. Just wondering, do we need to change any configuration file?



ubuntu@yow-tic-demo1:~$ masakari --debug segment-list
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/bin/masakari", line 10, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/masakariclient/shell.py", line 189, in main
    MasakariShell().main(args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/masakariclient/shell.py", line 160, in main
    sc = self._setup_masakari_client(api_ver, args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/masakariclient/shell.py", line 116, in _setup_masakari_client
    return masakari_client.Client(api_ver, user_agent=USER_AGENT, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/masakariclient/client.py", line 28, in Client
    return cls(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/masakariclient/v1/client.py", line 34, in __init__
    self.con = connection.create_connection(session)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/masakariclient/sdk/ha/connection.py", line 36, in create_connection
    raise e
AttributeError: Service Descriptors cannot be set'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-03-13 08:21:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi Louie,

Are you using openstacksdk0.12.0?
I have also found the same issue after updating openstacksdk0.12.0.
I'm investigating the cause, so I add -1."}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-03-13 09:26:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If we use os-service-type1.1.0, then the masakari command will succeed.
On the other hand, if we use os-service-type1.2.0, then it will fail.
os-service-type1.2.0 will be installed when installing openstacksdk0.12.0.

On the master branch, masakari command need to work with os-service-type1.2.0[1], so I'm considering how to fix.
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/upper-constraints.txt#L289"}, {'account_id': 26991, 'date': '2018-03-13 16:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Devstack has moved to openstacksdk0.12.0

Tried stack/pike is not working as well for devstack. It is now in the transition as there is no working branch either way.'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2018-04-04 07:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoned this patch since new patch[1] that removes sdk from masakariclient was submitted.
[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557634/'}]

commit_message:
Fix of masakari command for upcoming openstacksdk changes

In the next openstacksdk release, Profile is going away as
are entrypoints plugins. This patch modifies so that masakari
command can be used after that release.

Note: This code has been tested with a version other than
openstacksdk-0.10.0.

Change-Id: I162292cf6af2c4f716cbf1f2065488f0d30cdef6

subject: Fix WF execution getting stuck on null description
messages:
[{'account_id': 27349, 'date': '2018-03-28 13:29:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-03-29 05:09:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Ok, the change makes sense although at first glance it's not clear how this is even related to triggers.

Just two minor things that are better to fix before merging the patch.

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 27349, 'date': '2018-04-02 09:31:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-02 09:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27349, 'date': '2018-04-02 09:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

After the workflow execution is completed (success, error, cancelled), a call is made to handle cron/event triggers. If workflow execution was created by triggers, WF exec has the description field is json string with a field `triggered_by`. A `json.loads(wf_desc)` is done to look for json validation of description. Problem was that `json.loads(None)` raises TypeError whereas empty or invalid json string can raise ValueError which is caught and handled.

Rest minor comments are fixed.'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-04-03 05:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

As you note, there is a "TypeError: expected string or buffer" without this patch. Could we make the fix just a tad bit more resilient by checking for string type before calling json.loads() If for some reason the db gets corrupted, the same error will resurface.Or we can catch the TypeError too.'}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-04-03 07:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-04-03 10:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27349, 'date': '2018-04-04 03:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]

Closes-bug: #1711423

commit_message:
Fix WF execution getting stuck on null description

Fix bug where creating wf execution with null description
marks workflow as RUNNING even if all tasks are complete.

Change-Id: If53012a41f6481c88fef44a43a1f17738d558f02
Closes-bug: #1711423

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

Hyunsik - Welcome to the Tacker project! 

The proposal is interesting. Do you have a specific use-case / VNF in mind that will make use of this driver ? Also, as Kanagaraj suggested, create an RFE bug. We can have some discussion there.

BTW, healing at the VNFC level is something we definitely get to. But the fix / enhancement need to happen at the monitoring framework level.  Infact, that needs to be a separate RFE / spec different from this portscan driver.'}, {'account_id': 22290, 'date': '2016-08-01 07:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-08-01 08:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
Port scan driver for VNF application Monitoring

This driver is Port monitoring drivers for checking application
Status.

Until now, Tacker monitoring drivers can check network(ping) and
application(using HTTP URL).

Moreover, when VNF is rebooted by ping monitoring result, tacker
recreates all of the same VNFs.

In this situation, port monitoring driver helps for auto
healing of VNFC level and it is a useful when tacker check the
VNF inside status too.

Change-Id: I13a2e2ff90c8f30f2468f266c8ab39b948a86772
Implements: blueprint portscan-monitoring

[{'created': '2018-03-21 07:50:33.000000000', 'message': 'Author: tanmingxiao
DAte: Wed Mar 21 15:27:27 CST 2018

fix some mistake in doc/

I test the freezer with freezer-agent.rst and I find some mistake in cinder and nova  backups
 - cinder backup need --mode option otherwise  it will into the default mode fs
 - nova backup also need --mode option as well as cinder backup
 - nova backup need more necessary parameters，It is the --engine nova . --no-incremental True and --backup-name [BACKUP_NAME]
Fixes Bug1619158

Change-Id: I4a0a322ac0a439d2a170a5e6e93c4819556bfca9

commit_message:
fix some mistake in freezer user guide document(cinder backup)

I test the freezer with freezer-agent.rst and I find some mistake in
cinder and nova  backups
 - cinder backup need --mode option otherwise it will into the
   default mode fs
Closes-Bug:1619158

Change-Id: I4a0a322ac0a439d2a170a5e6e93c4819556bfca9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 17:29:04.000000000', 'message': 'Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I4907223e5a63226d8945de8b2d4f1e0dd11a6528
(cherry picked from commit 2193cbd10afeb2bc8b4ca97db9bf9e2fc54f9daf)

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I4907223e5a63226d8945de8b2d4f1e0dd11a6528
(cherry picked from commit 2193cbd10afeb2bc8b4ca97db9bf9e2fc54f9daf)

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I0998532143995dd8ced64cdd5660f2d44cbbcbb9
(cherry picked from commit 82501fd0cc55171e8565cb154f786f736114b9f0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 23:37:23.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: PowerVM Driver: Network interface attach/detach

This adds the ability to hotplug network interfaces for the powervm
virt driver.

commit_message:
PowerVM Driver: Network interface attach/detach

This adds the ability to hotplug network interfaces for the powervm
virt driver.

Blueprint: powervm-network-hotplug
Change-Id: I78b94c9731c35e3291d46b9bf9f5554e21c2429e

commit_message:
[VNX]Add `force detach` support

Add support to force detach a volume from all its attached hosts on VNX.

Closes-bug: #1741835
Change-Id: Ib1c82bbb3c898112b4cb51930e08a6aed4c497e2
(cherry picked from commit e91e7d5e2f599bc43ecdfbd0d7d5ede2ee813fac)

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ibc9be2d0905aae99f79092de6cae17c61672d46c

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I06e5afd0bfb627b2de64e93e51c182cf881e38d7
(cherry picked from commit e179d3680227728307dce7bb05dbbf0a8ab70274)

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option "auth_uri" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated[1].
Use option "www_authenticate_uri" from group "keystone_authtoken".

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Closes-Bug: #1759098

commit_message:
Restore tracing on exit points of block_device_create_config_file

We exit in several places and don't restore tracing.  Previously in
nodepool we relied on the default fallback, which did restore the
tracing.  Since we now use the MBR config file, we take the different
exit path without it and the debugging output is incomplete.

Change-Id: I586fc95517926025705ce376ec5c4aaf4122773f

must specify both the path to the script and the path to the local

With this patch, when running in "local" mode the location of the

commit_message:
pick requirements directory based on operating mode

Without this patch, users running the script to test changes locally
must specify both the path to the script and the path to the local
copy of the requirements repository. This is inconvenient.

With this patch, when running in "local" mode the location of the
script is used as the default for the --reqs argument. This means the
user does not need to pass an extra argument on the command line.

Change-Id: I739750ddff2da55ad059641343637f91f3416127
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Add deadlock retry wrapper for inital quota create
messages: [{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-04-03 16:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-04-04 02:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-04 04:10:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 16:58:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add deadlock retry wrapper for inital quota create

Since the initial quota record creation is using the autocommit session and
since it is creating the initial record, it will lock at the table(index)
level instead of at the record level. This can lead to a recoverable DB
Deadlock situation.
This was observed running the neutron-lbaas API tempest tests with concurrency
greater than 1.

This patch adds the oslo DB deadlock retry wrapper to this initial record
creation to allow deadlock recovery.

Change-Id: Ibbfa77f548fead3203cf081e203c5e70fe514111
(cherry picked from commit c8918b4194d51c5805a64968fdf7a67686fc0994)
'}]
commit_message:
Add deadlock retry wrapper for inital quota create

Since the initial quota record creation is using the autocommit session and
since it is creating the initial record, it will lock at the table(index)
level instead of at the record level. This can lead to a recoverable DB
Deadlock situation.
This was observed running the neutron-lbaas API tempest tests with concurrency
greater than 1.

This patch adds the oslo DB deadlock retry wrapper to this initial record
creation to allow deadlock recovery.

Change-Id: Ibbfa77f548fead3203cf081e203c5e70fe514111
(cherry picked from commit c8918b4194d51c5805a64968fdf7a67686fc0994)

Because we are removing fedora-26 support from nodepool, remove these

found the time to actually update these roles to test against
fedora-27.

And because I want to move these jobs in-tree, this give me the

"}]
commit_message:
Remove ansible-role-functional-jobs-fedora-26 for windmill

Because we are removing fedora-26 support from nodepool, remove these
jobs so we don't block that effort. This is fine, because I haven't
found the time to actually update these roles to test against
fedora-27.

And because I want to move these jobs in-tree, this give me the
modivation to add them back as fedora-27.

Change-Id: I5cf5a2d4e14b54f69bb250bf4a0b3053d54b3fa1
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468744

Change-Id: Ia03f538a7d2d10d600d9359da5b3a74532709d1f
Closes-Bug: #1758952
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DHCP isolated subnets with routed networks

After the merge of [1], the DHCP agent will fail to configure a routed
network when attempting to generate host routes for a non-local subnet
that is also isolated from the point of view of the metadata service.
This patch adds a check to make sure that the host route is not added
for non-local subnets.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468744

Change-Id: Ia03f538a7d2d10d600d9359da5b3a74532709d1f
Closes-Bug: #1758952

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: Find volume folder API call fails on root folders

Changes to the SC API have changed how calls are made to the
StorageCenter/ScVolumeFolder/GetList payload filter options. In
the case of a folder under root this call could fail depending on
the API.

Change-Id: I2ab2160478d2163dbb45175aa5f1b884f316db24
(cherry picked from commit c9a7fb8da533251772b79140c7161b393c52f15b)
(cherry picked from commit c9722a78b2dd5e7ae636fb6a6ac4c5996e1fbc56)
(cherry picked from commit 446e12c5ff620cc53969b0724386d82229bd3ca9)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 04:40:43.000000000', 'message': "Python 3.5: Image Import fails with Unicode Error

Newly added image import api fails for python 3.5 as it
raises Unicode error as it fails to open file in binary mode.

Added 'rb' mode while opening the file which will open the provided
file in binary mode.

Change-Id: I297a415d6fa8700c6a131e0931d11bda65265c73
Closes-Bug: #1759510
(cherry picked from commit ab4139e30ca56425fb4f62ebf2d5cb48a0455952)
"}]
commit_message:
Python 3.5: Image Import fails with Unicode Error

Newly added image import api fails for python 3.5 as it
raises Unicode error as it fails to open file in binary mode.

Added 'rb' mode while opening the file which will open the provided
file in binary mode.

Change-Id: I297a415d6fa8700c6a131e0931d11bda65265c73
Closes-Bug: #1759510
(cherry picked from commit ab4139e30ca56425fb4f62ebf2d5cb48a0455952)

subject: Drop sharding-is-not-enabled logging
messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-03 18:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-03 20:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 18:24:33.000000000', 'message': 'Drop sharding-is-not-enabled logging

WOW was that noisy! At least, on this dinky single-node install I was
previously using to run some swift3 func tests -- I saw stats like

            "visited": {
                "attempted": 0,
                "failure": 0,
                "skipped": 5781,
                "success": 0
            }

...where I'm pretty sure most/all of those were deleted DBs, waiting to
get reclaimed... and at that point, it's all just noise in the log.

Change-Id: I88f7b16490734419007ddc0a9e38a7509c5e570a
'}]
commit_message:
Drop sharding-is-not-enabled logging

WOW was that noisy! At least, on this dinky single-node install I was
previously using to run some swift3 func tests -- I saw stats like

            "visited": {
                "attempted": 0,
                "failure": 0,
                "skipped": 5781,
                "success": 0
            }

...where I'm pretty sure most/all of those were deleted DBs, waiting to
get reclaimed... and at that point, it's all just noise in the log.

Change-Id: I88f7b16490734419007ddc0a9e38a7509c5e570a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 18:07:12.000000000', 'message': 'Remove /etc/os-net-config/config.json in os-apply-config

In the new style of nic config files, os-net-config is invoked by
the script run-os-net-config.sh, not by os-apply-config.  This is the
only format supported in Queens. Remove the os-apply-config version
of /etc/os-net-config/config.json to prevent os-apply-config from
attempting to run with an empty config.json file.

Note that /etc/os-net-config/config.json no longer exists in
tripleo-image-elements.

Change-Id: Ica86382c4e5a1463ed8b2146e3ec490b7e2c9452
Closes-Bug: 1758161
(cherry picked from commit 20e5f2766cf97c463fc73175ddcf31a1d7fb558d)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove /etc/os-net-config/config.json in os-apply-config

In the new style of nic config files, os-net-config is invoked by
the script run-os-net-config.sh, not by os-apply-config.  This is the
only format supported in Queens. Remove the os-apply-config version
of /etc/os-net-config/config.json to prevent os-apply-config from
attempting to run with an empty config.json file.

Note that /etc/os-net-config/config.json no longer exists in
tripleo-image-elements.

Change-Id: Ica86382c4e5a1463ed8b2146e3ec490b7e2c9452
Closes-Bug: 1758161
(cherry picked from commit 20e5f2766cf97c463fc73175ddcf31a1d7fb558d)

commit_message:
Change unreasonable title

Content of "Mistral User Guide" is all of Installation.
So I think "Mistral Installation Guide" is a better title.

Change-Id: I1b20c2f665bee21b2f35f06912beab3e7e3e93ea
Signed-off-by: pengdake <19921207pq@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fixed puppet repo & key in Debian

It appears that the puppetlabs Debian repository is set to always
install a repository for Xenial (instead of using lsb_release to
find the OS), and that the Puppetlabs repo GPG key is outdated. This
patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I35231cdf7503d129bb408bc5d29a2cfe95c4e08e

Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ie4d52a2981bda8c65033a114174cfe39233e4972
Implements: blueprint deprecate-auth-uri-option

[{'created': '2018-03-31 20:58:59.000000000', 'message': "Make DiskFilter work with capsule

The scheduler needs to schedule container or capsule. If the target
is capsule, the capsule object doesn't have the 'disk' field.
Therefore, the scheduler needs to deal with the missing of 'disk'.

Change-Id: I47d821fb59c410157cff1428300136f78cd32f8a
"}]
commit_message:
Make DiskFilter work with capsule

The scheduler needs to schedule container or capsule. If the target
is capsule, the capsule object doesn't have the 'disk' field.
Therefore, the scheduler needs to deal with the missing of 'disk'.

Change-Id: I47d821fb59c410157cff1428300136f78cd32f8a

messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-03-31 19:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23365, 'date': '2018-04-02 01:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8264, 'date': '2018-04-04 01:26:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\ngood catch'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-31 19:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'Catch a specific exception on scheduling

If the scheduler fails to find a host for the container/capsule,
a NoValidHost exception is expected. Besides NoValidHost, other
exceptions are unexpected. This patch separated the handling of
expected and unexpected exception.

Change-Id: I3b39793a7911d36895e8ecc7fc9f2973355a3d81
'}]
commit_message:
Catch a specific exception on scheduling

If the scheduler fails to find a host for the container/capsule,
a NoValidHost exception is expected. Besides NoValidHost, other
exceptions are unexpected. This patch separated the handling of
expected and unexpected exception.

Change-Id: I3b39793a7911d36895e8ecc7fc9f2973355a3d81

If the container is restarting or rebuilding, we should skip state
population until the state become stable. Otherwise, it will be
read as UNKNOWN state which is incorrect.

Change-Id: Ie36ee6f9d508de6839f7114835b8e3ede186c93e
'}, {'created': '2018-03-30 22:32:18.000000000', 'message': 'Skip state population on transitional states

If the container is restarting or rebuilding, we should skip state

Change-Id: Ie36ee6f9d508de6839f7114835b8e3ede186c93e
'}]
commit_message:
Skip state population on transitional states

If the container is restarting or rebuilding, we should skip state
population until the state become stable. Otherwise, it will be
read as UNKNOWN state which is incorrect.

Change-Id: Ie36ee6f9d508de6839f7114835b8e3ede186c93e

commit_message:
[Horizon] Allow configuration of Keystone's URL

This commit introduces a new variable, horizon_keystone_url, which
allows the administrator to specify the Keystone URL.

This defaults to the internal Keystone URL for backwards compatibility's
sake.

Closes-Bug: #1759623

Change-Id: Idf178a6398000fcb2d02b6f37b8ef408218b94ee
Signed-off-by: Nick Jones <nick@stackhpc.com>

commit_message:
Allow members to be set as "backup"

Setting a member as "backup" means no traffic will be sent to it unless
all non-backup members are marked as down.

This should be essentially the same in every backend provider AFAIU.

This was requested by at least one operator (me) and was agreed during
the PTG to add value.

Story: 2001777
Task: 12483
Change-Id: I953abe71a0988da78efc6b3961f7518c81c2a06d

commit_message:
Add status_reason and logs on unknown state

If the container's status is set to UNKNOWN, we need more
information for users/admins for trouble-shooting. This patch
set status_reason of the container to explain the reason.
In addition, print more debug information to the logs.

Change-Id: I927c4beb2b1dcb6aea3c983d6a1b62965d60d52f

[{'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-03-26 22:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-03-26 22:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

testing'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-03-28 18:33:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-03-29 04:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It looks fine, have you tested this out? How is the neutron UID generated? Will the container that sets the permissions have the same neutron UID as the container that runs the dhcp?'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-03-29 04:38:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17280, 'date': '2018-03-29 16:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Unfortunately the undercloud I was using became corrupt and I have to set everything back up to test it.  The UID is generated by installing the RPM, and is specified in the spec file.  Since the base neutron container image will already have neutron RPM installed the UID should be the same between the containers launched during deployment. commit_message:
Fixes Neutron certificate and key permissions

The Neutron UID is not static and may be different between the host and
neutron container.  Since we generate certificates and keys on the host
for neutron and then mount them in a container, it is highly likely the
container Neutron UID will not match the one used on the host to
generate the files and reading these files will fail in the container.

This patch modifies the permissions after the files are mounted in the
container to be owned by the correct Neutron UID.

Closes-Bug: 1759049

Depends-On: I83b14b91d1ee600bd9d5863acba34303921368ce

Change-Id: Ibad3f1af4b44459e96a6dc9937e5fcef3e6335f4
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move search_image to container driver

This refactoring is for making the code structure more consistent.
In particular, the image driver will be decoupled from compute
manager and align with volume/network driver.
In the new structure, compute manager is mainly for interfacing
with docker driver and docker driver is for interfacing with
image/volume/network drivers.

Change-Id: Ia8e6c9d8868fde1f650f9c56cade5e4b7dde507b

commit_message:
Move pull_image to container driver

This refactoring is for making the code structure more consistent.
In particular, the image driver will be decoupled from compute
manager and align with volume/network driver.
In the new structure, compute manager is mainly for interfacing
with docker driver and docker driver is for interfacing with
image/volume/network drivers.

Change-Id: Ie5bfbe6dac36818348985b9bdc11106a04f77b8c

commit_message:
Removes neutron ownership of certs

Since neutron UID is not static, setting the owners on the certificates
in the host to be 'neutron' will not match the UID for neutron in the
deployed container.  Therefore this patch removes the host neutron
ownership and leaves it as root, so that it can be later modified in the
container to be chowned to neutron.

Partial-Bug: 1759049

Change-Id: I83b14b91d1ee600bd9d5863acba34303921368ce
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 16:58:21.000000000', 'message': "Update python usage docs

The keystoneauth1 get_plugin_loader method requires that a
OS_USER_DOMAIN be specified.  Our docs don't include that
detail.

This change adds the extra needed field.  There's also some
problems currently with loading the client directly as it's
currently documented, which appears to be a bug in the client
code itself.

commit_message:
Update python usage docs

The keystoneauth1 get_plugin_loader method requires that a
OS_USER_DOMAIN be specified.  Our docs don't include that
detail.

This change adds the extra needed field.  There's also some
problems currently with loading the client directly as it's
currently documented, which appears to be a bug in the client
code itself.

Change-Id: Idacbb47f9aae1e461379eec4a5e224b0157a8dc4
Partial-Bug: #1758104

commit_message:
[placement] Add to contributor docs about handler testing

A recent IRC conversation [1] discussed that there are generally no tests
for the placement handler code (the wsgi methods that respond to each
URI and HTTP method). This change adds a paragraph to point out that
this is mostly intentional and that when they get complex it would
be a good idea to extract a method.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-03-28.log.html#t2018-03-28T13:00:40

Change-Id: I09774c123068e42e6a828fc37455dc5d374486b9

[{'created': '2018-03-26 14:53:13.000000000', 'message': 'Unit test framework: common FakeResponse

Faking out requests.Response as a mock return value can be awkward,
particularly due to how a real Response responds to a boolean check
(False for status codes >=400).  Attempting to use a real Response is
also awkward when it needs to have a payload, due to indirection and
encoding.

This change set introduces a module, nova.tests.unit.fake_requests,
intended to hold fakes for things found in the requests module.  For
now, it holds FakeResponse, which provides a convenient way to create a
Response-like that can be used as a mock return value, which responds
like a real Response to most operations on it.

We swap this into various test modules that were previously using other
mechanisms to fake Response instances.

Change-Id: Iaeced55c442afdcb277de97829f52fe3c02a380a

commit_message:
Unit test framework: common FakeResponse

Faking out requests.Response as a mock return value can be awkward,
particularly due to how a real Response responds to a boolean check
(False for status codes >=400).  Attempting to use a real Response is
also awkward when it needs to have a payload, due to indirection and
encoding.

This change set introduces a module, nova.tests.unit.fake_requests,
intended to hold fakes for things found in the requests module.  For
now, it holds FakeResponse, which provides a convenient way to create a
Response-like that can be used as a mock return value, which responds
like a real Response to most operations on it.

We swap this into various test modules that were previously using other
mechanisms to fake Response instances.

Change-Id: Iaeced55c442afdcb277de97829f52fe3c02a380a

commit_message:
[placement] Add test for provider summaries

In ``GET /allocation_candidates`` API, ``provider_summaries``
should show all the inventories for all the resource classes
in all the resource providers.

However, ``provider_summaries`` currently doesn't contain
resources that aren't requested.

This patch adds a simple test case to describe the bug.

Change-Id: Ida9cddc5a2b43917e7b5900fe68a413b18c6cb2d
Partial-Bug: #1760276

commit_message:
Error path of WSGIScriptAlias of panko for ubuntu

Error path[1] of WSGIScriptAlias of panko for ubuntu, the right path is
/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/panko/api/app.wsgi.

[1]http://logs.openstack.org/02/504302/4/check/puppet-openstack-beaker-xenial/aeb24d6/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-02-28_00_39_06_878490

Change-Id: I87531e4e5ef80e704bae52ed36a6cdbb01d4cffa
Closes-Bug: #1753865

commit_message:
Migrate dsvm functional test jobs to project repo

Zuul3-related changes in master have moved functional test gate
configuration out of infra/project-config and into the glanceclient
repository.  This patch backports these changes so that the stable
branch has functional test gates.

Not a pure cherry-pick, also includes setting SWIFT_HASH, which
did not have to be done in master.

Co-authored-by: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

(cherry picked from commit c0e63d977fc077be55a02106403840165b89a349)
(cherry picked from commit a5985508817e5de73092a339f15ce7f9f701a20f)

Depends-On: I84de60181cb88574e341ff83cd4857cce241f2dd
Depends-On: I0fecb027e5be6f4d7bb0bf34e59a43543a421f38
Change-Id: Idaa2f4b920e131320499c9e460ade74df1d5a264

commit_message:
Always generate ara reports for integration tests

If you're running these tests, you're very likely interested in the
ansible output, even on successful runs.  We already do this for the
multinode jobs, but not the single nodes.  Add it.

Change-Id: I222be961a876c179d1c9274f56582b0afac4f47c

commit_message:
Add restart() method to DecayingTimer

This merely provides a restart() method that passes through to the existing
restart() method on the StopWatch used as the internal for DecayingTimer so
that we can reset it.

Change-Id: Ie6b607ec588db94e2c768bd22ae736a05ab484c1

[{'created': '2018-03-20 23:14:36.000000000', 'message': 'Better Sem-Ver header handling

This makes Sem-Ver header handling more reliable by ignoring any
potential user configured git log output format. Instead PBR supplies
its own format string that will output the commit message bodies in
their entirety without wrapping and other whitespace formatting done for
humans.

Change-Id: I957a8c182585119534b4e02c34e7140a3e07d1d6
Related-Bug: 1738685
Fixes-Bug: 1704625
'}]
commit_message:
Better Sem-Ver header handling

This makes Sem-Ver header handling more reliable by ignoring any
potential user configured git log output format. Instead PBR supplies
its own format string that will output the commit message bodies in
their entirety without wrapping and other whitespace formatting done for
humans.

Change-Id: I957a8c182585119534b4e02c34e7140a3e07d1d6
Related-Bug: 1738685
Fixes-Bug: 1704625

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ieca3f4978e947ce52d645ddab0f4523c90d03c75
(cherry picked from commit 0c6bfe96e9f127e62b0e9e6ffea6cbbd38b37b89)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Id71e1a71a0f9fa342a286ef62c8dc6ca784ae61a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-03-30 01:02:45.000000000', 'message': "Make getopt and eol_branch.sh agree on the name for the dry-run argument

If we run eol_branch.sh with --dry-run we get told it's an unknown
argument.  This is because we're calling getopt with 'dry'.  Let's give

Change-Id: I379ebdaa3c9d48218df974d01de2c76744d21c6f
"}]
commit_message:
Make getopt and eol_branch.sh agree on the name for the dry-run argument

If we run eol_branch.sh with --dry-run we get told it's an unknown
argument.  This is because we're calling getopt with 'dry'.  Let's give
getopt the right name.

Change-Id: I379ebdaa3c9d48218df974d01de2c76744d21c6f

commit_message:
Support zuul's standard override-checkout variable

Similar change to ironic's dcc5546b49ad7a791a00284999e6db4a802792b1.
Allows using inspector's jobs in the ironic-tempest-plugin gate.

Change-Id: I69d91ac4b00dabfd917f097d70f0b38e0a4fc4c6

commit_message:
Fix N332 api_version decorator hacking check

We spuriously ran afoul of N332 here [1].  This change set fixes the
hacking check to be a little narrower and avoid (at least some) false
positives.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557508/1/nova/tests/unit/volume/test_cinder.py@1014

Change-Id: I8c5e0854141d7c329483d00d26de7078dc756ee0

vhd/x images.

[{'created': '2018-03-29 12:25:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove LABEL from API definitions

LABEL is now useless and plays no role that ALIAS can play

For this reason and since it can be a source of confusion for
people writing API definition files ("what the hell is this used for ?
what am I supposed to put here ?"), this change removes it.

The only places where this remains are https://bit.ly/2Gha5Xw (codesearch).
Cleaning up in these places is handled by the commits
which this change is depending on.

commit_message:
Remove LABEL from API definitions

LABEL is now useless and plays no role that ALIAS can play

For this reason and since it can be a source of confusion for
people writing API definition files ("what the hell is this used for ?
what am I supposed to put here ?"), this change removes it.

The only places where this remains are https://bit.ly/2Gha5Xw (codesearch).
Cleaning up in these places is handled by the commits
which this change is depending on.

Depends-On: Ida395d94ed5b54ef9c42dc19cf099aab54fd0bb5
Depends-On: I4f0f94ce8d526bf6e1012823409582d46402625b
Depends-On: I96876caaba1e2663eb0451335327cb1276420d4f

Change-Id: I7e2502f8591ad664d20e23e58f33291575f29083

commit_message:
OVO: add cluster get_by_name

Add a cluster object method to query by name.  This will useful in
replication promotion where a service may be a member of a cluster and
that cluster must also be updated as part of the promotion operation.

Change-Id: I85d09e38dddaf89111f4500de41ee7b02c892609

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 16:54:08.000000000', 'message': "Use the venv contents instead of a git source for templates

When deploying the base templates for api-paste, policy files
and other files which are included in the service git source,
we now use the venv files instead of requiring access to a
git source and a complex set of lookups and variable
implementations.

This is simpler and more cross-series, and works from Queens
due to the related bug's patches.

Change-Id: I6a4e2514e66b15b2ae227e62b6dc9ae1a50a4fbd
Related-Bug: #1718356

commit_message:
Use the venv contents instead of a git source for templates

When deploying the base templates for api-paste, policy files
and other files which are included in the service git source,
we now use the venv files instead of requiring access to a
git source and a complex set of lookups and variable
implementations.

This is simpler and more cross-series, and works from Queens
due to the related bug's patches.

Change-Id: I6a4e2514e66b15b2ae227e62b6dc9ae1a50a4fbd
Related-Bug: #1718356

commit_message:
Switch tox unit test command to use ostestr

This commit switches the tox command to use ostestr instead of calling
testr through setup.py. The primary advantage here is that it uses the
subunit-trace output filter. ostestr primarily exists as a replacement
for pretty_tox.sh bash scripts which spread like a plague through
OpenStack projects after Nova copied it from Tempest. (although
ostestr also provides some other useful features) Granted ironic-specs
wasn't using that, but this commit makes the switch to enable getting
the subunit-trace output which is generally useful.

Note that this dramatically increases output while running tests.
However, test failures are still at the bottom of the output, so it
shouldn't cause much pain, if any.

Change-Id: I4e0241eea113f994cadf68bdfe647065856d3a6d

commit_message:
Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was depreacted in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.
Also drops py27dj110 from tox.ini as horizon droped
Django 1.10 support in Rocky.

blueprint django2-support

Change-Id: I8e0dcb64e1c82580767db482631450ba38654fc3

commit_message:
Use the default queue when calling create_deployment_plan

This change happened in tripleoclient[1], but never in instack-undercloud.
Using a uuid queue name means a queue is left in Zaqar but never used
- we don't consume the messages from it or delete the queue.

[1]: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/?id=1bd1620eadf23f2ee755a32a8167d9a5386a392e

Closes-Bug: #1757387
Change-Id: I5d39200e7292a5c1750601ec0669f462e7b1c164

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-02 17:03:29.000000000', 'message': 'get-occ-config.sh: fix handling multiple nodes in a role

When using get-occ-config.sh with a role with a count greater
than 1, the script will now configure all nodes that are of that role
type instead of exiting after only configuring the first.

Previously, the expression ((i++)) evaluated to 0, and when using
arithmetic expansion, causes a rc of 1, which caused the script to exit
after configuring the first node.

Change-Id: I0a39f2b8f1de5302fd426999acfe5043b0361987
Closes-Bug: #1759581
(cherry picked from commit 154879b68dfe3ff3834babcfb1d619a4d05044af)
'}]
commit_message:
get-occ-config.sh: fix handling multiple nodes in a role

When using get-occ-config.sh with a role with a count greater
than 1, the script will now configure all nodes that are of that role
type instead of exiting after only configuring the first.

Previously, the expression ((i++)) evaluated to 0, and when using
arithmetic expansion, causes a rc of 1, which caused the script to exit
after configuring the first node.

Change-Id: I0a39f2b8f1de5302fd426999acfe5043b0361987
Closes-Bug: #1759581
(cherry picked from commit 154879b68dfe3ff3834babcfb1d619a4d05044af)

I also removed the abort state transition, since we already have a ``fail`` path.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-10-16 13:34:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thank you. Since the inspection abort is an asynchronous call, we need to define a mechanism to ensure that the completion status is retrieved from Inspector and updated with the corresponding Ironic node.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2017-10-18 07:48:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Thanks for review, yes, abort is an asynchronous request as introspect, but it's simply power off the node and update node cache, once the request is accepted, it never fails (no uncaptured raises).
Once the abort request is accepted, we can safely assume the operation will succeed and move node state to inspect failed, that also bypass the periodic inspector status checking.

Ideally, we should define a new transient state like inspect aborting, then check the final result periodically, but from current implementation, I think it's safe to avoid a new state."}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-10-18 12:29:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

(6 comments)

Hi guys!

I guess Shivanand has a point here. I'd vote postponing this spec approval till we decide on the fate of the inspect-wait state; it may reshape the discussion about the suggested API here, giving justification to the 202 answer to an abort call. See also my concern inline.

Unsure about what to vote, leaving a 0 (as I agree with the 202 but would like to wait for that inspect-wait, ironic? ;)

Cheers,
milan"}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2017-10-19 03:43:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(3 comments)

Thanks fellows, the async request is an issue needs to be clarified, my first thought is to do it in a simple way, but looks like we want a more generic one'}, {'account_id': 18653, 'date': '2017-10-20 11:59:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

TL;DR: let's adopt the inspect-wait state[1]

Thanks!
milan

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-12 09:25:44.000000000', 'message': "Support baremetal inspection abort operation

Currently, we can't abort the process of node inspection from
ironic api. When a node is not properly setup under inspection
network, admins can only wait it to fail after a specified timeout
value, or by using ``baremetal introspection abort`` manually to
abort introspection process. It may cause unnecessary time
consumption in such cases.

This spec will support ironic api handling abort from the
inspecting state.

Change-Id: I54775e12ef558fd99c8d6f517e91348e6f0261c3
Related-bug: #1703089
"}, {'created': '2017-07-12 09:33:53.000000000', 'message': "Support baremetal inspection abort operation

ironic api. When a node is not properly setup under inspection
network, admins can only wait it to fail after a specified timeout
value, or by using ``baremetal introspection abort`` manually to
abort introspection process. It may cause unnecessary time
consumption in such cases.

This spec will support ironic api handling abort from the
inspecting state.

Change-Id: I54775e12ef558fd99c8d6f517e91348e6f0261c3
Related-bug: #1703089
"}, {'created': '2017-07-12 14:10:52.000000000', 'message': "Support baremetal inspection abort operation

Currently, we can't abort the process of node inspection from
ironic api. When a node is not properly setup under inspection
network, admins can only wait it to fail after a specified timeout
value, or by using ``baremetal introspection abort`` manually to
abort introspection process. It may cause unnecessary time
consumption in such cases.

This spec will support ironic api handling abort from the

Change-Id: I54775e12ef558fd99c8d6f517e91348e6f0261c3
Related-bug: #1703089
"}, {'created': '2017-07-17 07:10:53.000000000', 'message': "Support baremetal inspection abort operation

Currently, we can't abort the process of node inspection from
ironic api. When a node is not properly setup under inspection
network, admins can only wait it to fail after a specified
timeout value, or by using inspector api, or
``openstack baremetal introspection abort`` command to abort the
introspection process.

Although the inspection state will be synchronized to ironic by
periodic task, it will create a little delay of time. Node state
will be inconsistent between ironic api and inspector api before
next state synchronization. The time defaults to 60 seconds, but
may vary depends to user configuration.

This spec will support ironic handling abort from the inspecting
state.

Change-Id: I54775e12ef558fd99c8d6f517e91348e6f0261c3
Related-bug: #1703089
"}, {'created': '2017-07-31 12:10:47.000000000', 'message': "Support baremetal inspection abort operation

introspection process.

Although the inspection state will be synchronized to ironic by
periodic task, it will create a little delay of time. Node state
will be inconsistent between ironic api and inspector api before
next state synchronization. The time defaults to 60 seconds, but
may vary depends to user configuration.

This spec will support ironic handling abort from the inspecting
state.

commit_message:
Support baremetal inspection abort operation

Currently, we can't abort the process of node inspection from
ironic api. When a node is not properly setup under inspection
network, admins can only wait it to fail after a specified
timeout value, or by using inspector api, or
``openstack baremetal introspection abort`` command to abort the
introspection process.

Although the inspection state will be synchronized to ironic by
periodic task, it will create a little delay of time. Node state
will be inconsistent between ironic api and inspector api before
next state synchronization. The time defaults to 60 seconds, but
may vary depends to user configuration.

This spec will support ironic handling abort from the inspect wait
state. The inspect wait state is required before this spec can
proceed, which will be addressed by [1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1725211

Change-Id: I54775e12ef558fd99c8d6f517e91348e6f0261c3
Related-bug: #1703089

commit_message:
Run 'tox -edocs' with python 2 for now

One of our dependency - yasfb - is not compatible with python 3.
This causes 'tox -edocs' to fail on systems where python 3 is
the default. This change temporary switches it to python 2.

Change-Id: I2d23bd86c0c63249b2ef778a4cc893d902ce866f

[{'created': '2017-06-22 18:20:07.000000000', 'message': "DNM: PoC for decouple db spec

DON'T MERGE THIS PATCH

This is some sample code that implements a Proof of Concept (PoC) for
[1] allowing us to decouple neutron database related imports by using
plugin binding via neutron-lib.

In this patch:
- neutron_lib.bindings.base defines a simple plugin loader and the
parent class for all binding interfaces in lib.
- neutron_lib.bindings.objects.base stubs out the public interface for
some base OVOs. These are private interface-only (not expecting them to
be backed by a plugin) classes so other OVOs can extend/use their
public defintions.
- neutron_lib.bindings.objects.qos.policy defines the QosPolicy binding
interface for OVO. This class will be backed by it's corresponding
neutron object at runtime when using binding.

I tested in a virtual env by simply exposing the neutron ovo as a plugin
[2] and then consuming the neutron-lib change in [3]. The UTs in [3]
pass in this venv test thereby proving (IMHO) this approach could work.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473531/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/476650/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/476648/

Change-Id: I2c1839734967122e832a6e510946bba9a154b114
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: PoC for decouple db spec

DON'T MERGE THIS PATCH

This is some sample code that implements a Proof of Concept (PoC) for
[1] allowing us to decouple neutron database related imports by using
plugin binding via neutron-lib.

In this patch:
- neutron_lib.bindings.base defines a simple plugin loader and the
parent class for all binding interfaces in lib.
- neutron_lib.bindings.objects.base stubs out the public interface for
some base OVOs. These are private interface-only (not expecting them to
be backed by a plugin) classes so other OVOs can extend/use their
public defintions.
- neutron_lib.bindings.objects.qos.policy defines the QosPolicy binding
interface for OVO. This class will be backed by it's corresponding
neutron object at runtime when using binding.

I tested in a virtual env by simply exposing the neutron ovo as a plugin
[2] and then consuming the neutron-lib change in [3]. The UTs in [3]
pass in this venv test thereby proving (IMHO) this approach could work.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473531/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/476650/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/476648/

Change-Id: I2c1839734967122e832a6e510946bba9a154b114

commit_message:
Assign Cinder's backend_host when deploying for HA

When deploying for HA, set cinder's backend_host option (not the host
option) to "hostgroup". That way, only the cinder-volume backend drivers
use a common value.

Closes-Bug: #1753596
Depends-On: I78a88725d297794efd854fbfb14df0611e0e0738
Change-Id: Ifa4cd1f43fd5d73fc21630cee45b9f38fa882349
(cherry picked from commit 99ea8b681f11679c50920f291a744a7b31a7511d)

commit_message:
Ceph: Mgr: force key creation on each restart

This PS forces keyring creation on each start of the mgr container.

It resolves an issue found following k8s outage, where sometimes
the key is not created correctly the 1st time the container starts.

Change-Id: I7e642ca49883ac823196730362b796cd52cd841c

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary fields from SelectRoutersStep.contributes

SelectRoutersStep.contributes contains non-existing fields
"all_routers_selected" and "Select No Routers".
It is confusing for future maintenance. Let's drop them.

Change-Id: Ie4f710f28328623d1bd56d6298fd638615f6a14f

commit_message:
New configuration being added for Cisco UCSM ML2 driver

Cisco UCSM ML2 driver now accepts the following new configuration
parameters:
1. ucsm_https_verify
2. sp_template_list
3. vnic_template_list

 Conflicts:
       manifests/plugins/ml2/cisco/ucsm.pp
       spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_cisco_ucsm_spec.rb

Change-Id: I974c51a4bee4dc2e084cea809b3f93978d09c63b
Closes-Bug: #1742796
(cherry picked from commit b61e1f5e337fcd9fb198ee8568157d28cf1d8bf6)

ansible-playbook.

commit_message:
Add --use-hostnames to tripleo-ansible-inventory

Using hostnames in the ansible inventory is more user friendly than IP
addresses and results in more easily interpreted output when running
ansible-playbook.

This commit adds a --use-hostnames option to tripleo-ansible-inventory
to enable hostnames in the inventory for the connection string instead
of IP addresses.

Change-Id: Id4b40c2dc0270b4f9d9dcf029169df33967d84d9
Depends-On: I1602e66230255e57c739daaecb7be8cba83b0b6d

commit_message:
Deployment steps framework

This proposes refactoring the existing deployment code/process
so that we have a deploy steps framework that is similar to
our clean steps framework.

This would be the first step towards supporting customizable
deployment steps based on the user's requirements that are
only known at deploy time.

Change-Id: I2f68170e6741b0dbb6d5fbd5315a3be9fd7b28a7
Story: 1753128
Task: 10665

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-20 17:48:26.000000000', 'message': 'DVR: Inter Tenant Traffic between networks not possible with shared net

Inter Tenant Traffic between two different networks that belong
to two different Tenants is not possible when connected through
a shared network that are internally connected through DVR
routers.

This issue can be seen in multinode environment where there
is network isolation.

The issue is, we have two different IP for the ports that are
connecting the two routers and DVR does not expose the router
interfaces outside a compute and is blocked by ovs tunnel bridge
rules.

This patch fixes the issue by not applying the DVR specific
rules in the tunnel-bridge to the shared network ports that
are connecting the routers.

Closes-Bug: #1751396
Change-Id: I0717f29209f1354605d2f4128949ddbaefd99629
(cherry picked from commit d019790fe436b72cb05b8d0ff1f3a62ebd9e9bee)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Inter Tenant Traffic between networks not possible with shared net

Inter Tenant Traffic between two different networks that belong
to two different Tenants is not possible when connected through
a shared network that are internally connected through DVR
routers.

This issue can be seen in multinode environment where there
is network isolation.

The issue is, we have two different IP for the ports that are
connecting the two routers and DVR does not expose the router
interfaces outside a compute and is blocked by ovs tunnel bridge
rules.

This patch fixes the issue by not applying the DVR specific
rules in the tunnel-bridge to the shared network ports that
are connecting the routers.

Closes-Bug: #1751396
Change-Id: I0717f29209f1354605d2f4128949ddbaefd99629
(cherry picked from commit d019790fe436b72cb05b8d0ff1f3a62ebd9e9bee)

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I41941cf3a7656c02e858d3814760fc174b826c37

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ia6e28d103a43123bc6e40b1922ea9a9ee8f438ba

[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-25 04:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2018-03-26 05:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-26 05:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-26 13:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-04-03 08:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-04-03 09:42:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So the requirements-check job fails because lower-constraints.txt has Sphinx==1.6.5, while the minimum requirement is 1.6.2 (which is also in the requirements project global-requirements.txt).

How should we proceed here?'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-03 11:42:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Change the minimum version of sphinx to 1.6.5.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-04-03 12:59:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Change the minimum version of sphinx to 1.6.5.

Tried this in PS2 (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/556126/2/test-requirements.txt), and the CI job also failed, because it doesn't match https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/global-requirements.txt#L422"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 13:33:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-04-03 13:34:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Change the minimum version of sphinx to 1.6.5.
 > 
 > Tried this in PS2 (see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/556126/2/test-requirements.txt),
 > and the CI job also failed, because it doesn't match
 > https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/global-requirements.txt#L422

That version is passing the tests for me locally, so I have re-proposed it as PS4. I'll take a look at the failure if it happens in the gate again."}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-04-03 13:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2018-04-03 13:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-04-03 14:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I538e86c3fe10d09bc3b0f259d33a49aeb4ffd2e2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I0998532143995dd8ced64cdd5660f2d44cbbcbb9

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I4907223e5a63226d8945de8b2d4f1e0dd11a6528

commit_message:
Pass connection info via ansible config file

Pass the name of the remote user and the path to the private key to
ansible via the generated configuration file. This allows to re-use the
same connection info for nested ansible calls.

The other options, which affect how ansible runs the playbooks, should
remain on the command line.

Change-Id: Ic3be4f7e9fb52ac95b20ebbbc2f2d538a1fc80e6

fixed.

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Ieca3f4978e947ce52d645ddab0f4523c90d03c75

commit_message:
docker: take mistral-api config from puppet

For some reasons, the mistral-api config wasn't merging with the one
from puppet so we were missing a bunch of parameters.
This patch will do like other mistral services, merge with mistral-api
in puppet/services and do not release on mistral-base only anymore.

Change-Id: Ib3dc75a25591e8c17359cbe185fe9239b3dfbf91

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-03 02:42:13.000000000', 'message': 'Cleaned up logging

* Removed all remaning log translation.
* Always lazy-load logging.

Logs should no longer be translated (starting with Pike)[1].

Also, according to OpenStack Guideline[2], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/thread.html#113365
[2]: https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Ice91e70aec959b7433eb7df493ee589f9aeecf2c
'}]
commit_message:
Cleaned up logging

* Removed all remaning log translation.
* Always lazy-load logging.

Logs should no longer be translated (starting with Pike)[1].

Also, according to OpenStack Guideline[2], logged string message should be
interpolated by the logger.

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/thread.html#113365
[2]: https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Ice91e70aec959b7433eb7df493ee589f9aeecf2c

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ifcc589a006e79d9256993377ec8ab2af9b1326df
Implements: blueprint deprecate-auth-uri-option

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I9558937a133eebdee090d3999a00567d788b7a0c

Ben's pre-warning was a nice heads up but having broken a lot of stuff recently I'm a little nervous"}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2018-03-28 05:12:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-03-28 14:34:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-03-28 16:00:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Looks good to me but I'd like a +1 from Ben or Monty just in case
 > given this is pbr and everything uses it :)
 > 
 > Ben's pre-warning was a nice heads up but having broken a lot of
 > stuff recently I'm a little nervous

I think we do need to bite the bullet and get this out in the wild, but I would be okay with waiting until after the upcoming holiday weekend when a lot of people may be unavailable to look at any failures.  What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-28 16:43:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

this will delay the per-project requirements, but ack'd"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-28 21:04:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Yeah, would be good to get this out there given the number of things hanging off it. Fine to wait until after said weekend though, yeah'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-28 23:20:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

subject: Add deadlock retry wrapper for inital quota create
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-03-27 23:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-03-31 22:15:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For reference: http://logs.openstack.org/81/544281/7/gate/neutron-lbaasv2-dsvm-py3x-api/b446de3/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-12_19_21_50_498223'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-04-02 18:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM.

Also woah, umm.. Our multinode tests work now? Just coincidence?'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-04-03 15:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2018-04-03 16:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 733e683c8606688b9b1f66283f1b35f3e3c1de57'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 23:12:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add deadlock retry wrapper for inital quota create

Since the initial quota record creation is using the autocommit session and
since it is creating the initial record, it will lock at the table(index)
level instead of at the record level. This can lead to a recoverable DB
Deadlock situation.
This was observed running the neutron-lbaas API tempest tests with concurrency
greater than 1.

This patch adds the oslo DB deadlock retry wrapper to this initial record
creation to allow deadlock recovery.

Change-Id: Ibbfa77f548fead3203cf081e203c5e70fe514111
'}]
commit_message:
Add deadlock retry wrapper for inital quota create

Since the initial quota record creation is using the autocommit session and
since it is creating the initial record, it will lock at the table(index)
level instead of at the record level. This can lead to a recoverable DB
Deadlock situation.
This was observed running the neutron-lbaas API tempest tests with concurrency
greater than 1.

This patch adds the oslo DB deadlock retry wrapper to this initial record
creation to allow deadlock recovery.

Change-Id: Ibbfa77f548fead3203cf081e203c5e70fe514111

commit_message:
Update API-REF for x-forwarded-port is string

The API reference document had a typo where the "X-Forwarded-Port"
parameter for the HTTP header insertions was listed as an integer
instead of as a string. It also corrects "X-Forwarded-For" to be a
string. This patch corrects that mistake.

Change-Id: I3996d5e1950f8d979eb1c354dfac70a0ddefdca2

commit_message:
Remove unused tempest variables

Tempest is installed from the published version in pypi,
so there's no need to set any of the git-related vars.

Change-Id: I90eb47092ade45b5f18a2a55eda9b25f68114c57

Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

commit_message:
Do not generate the html ARA report any more

With [1] we no longer need to generate the html report,
so in this patch we change the log collection process
in order to use the new mechanism.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128902.html

Change-Id: Ic05ac14ef8bc2f67c40f6d5356edbff32f5e6c5c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-18 16:02:22.000000000', 'message': 'Run containerized mistral-api eventlet

The mistral-api container image we use doesn't have the necessary
packages to run via wsgi and this cause puppet to error with:

  "Notice: /Stage[main]/Mistral::Wsgi::Apache/Openstacklib::Wsgi::Apache[mistral_wsgi]/File[mistral_wsgi]: Dependency File[/var/www/cgi-bin/mistral] has failures: true",

Fallback to eventlet mistral-api for the time being until we get
a usable mistral-api image.

Change-Id: Ic10c579aa3b6d0d6a01f120669be3b5dcc5efcda
Related-Bug: #1724607

commit_message:
Run containerized mistral-api eventlet

The mistral-api container image we use doesn't have the necessary
packages to run via wsgi and this cause puppet to error with:

  "Notice: /Stage[main]/Mistral::Wsgi::Apache/Openstacklib::Wsgi::Apache[mistral_wsgi]/File[mistral_wsgi]: Dependency File[/var/www/cgi-bin/mistral] has failures: true",

Fallback to eventlet mistral-api for the time being until we get
a usable mistral-api image.

Change-Id: Ic10c579aa3b6d0d6a01f120669be3b5dcc5efcda
Depends-On: I54627f1c5a8867738a55bee42075bb6087830c61

[{'created': '2018-03-28 12:28:55.000000000', 'message': "Reduce scope of the lock for image volume cache

Refactor the code that creates a volume from a downloaded glance image
to minimize the scope of the lock that prevents multiple entries in the
volume image cache. Now the lock serializes only the portion of the
code that causes the cache entry to be created. Locking is minimized
when the volume is already cached, or when the volume won't be cached.

Closes-Bug: #1758414
Change-Id: I547fb4bcdd4783225b8ca96d157c61ca3bcf4ef4
(cherry picked from commit a351cd01c0bf937e82efc3e1256da479be24cfcf)
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce scope of the lock for image volume cache

Refactor the code that creates a volume from a downloaded glance image
to minimize the scope of the lock that prevents multiple entries in the
volume image cache. Now the lock serializes only the portion of the
code that causes the cache entry to be created. Locking is minimized
when the volume is already cached, or when the volume won't be cached.

Closes-Bug: #1758414
Change-Id: I547fb4bcdd4783225b8ca96d157c61ca3bcf4ef4
(cherry picked from commit a351cd01c0bf937e82efc3e1256da479be24cfcf)

commit_message:
The 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' has been replaced

The 'SAHARA_AUTO_IP_ALLOCATION_ENABLED' config parameter in Sahara
was deprecated and replaced by 'SAHARA_FLOATING_IP_DISABLED'
which has a less confusing name. The support for nova-network
has been removed in Sahara.

See the patch:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/531092/

Change-Id: Ib254e9df7a4bc378105c736dd4b07610cf77b545

commit_message:
Allow users to skip services to cut down on conflicts

We have received complaints that the openstack-service-setup.yml
playbooks will try to overwrite flavors and images of the same
name that may have different attributes.  This is due to them
requiring some unique configurations that just so happen to
have been using the same name in tests.  The tag additions
will allow them to work around this by skipping the ones
conflicting with existing entries.

Change-Id: I3eef87f522a219d094181fa64933f86142b060ef
Closes-Bug: 1760219

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests,
which were arguably inadequately mocked at that time.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Change-Id: I622ea092e780cf1ec38cbd949ee02d3ed4903f63
Related-Bug: #1760720

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests,
which were arguably inadequately mocked at that time.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Change-Id: I87a3aa68d0d71bacf1e552b6d1acaa5e1521e888
Related-Bug: #1760720

commit_message:
Add support for writing hostnames to inventory

Using hostnames in the ansible inventory is more user friendly than IP
addresses and results in more easily interpreted output when running
ansible-playbook.

This commit adds an option to inventory.py to use hostnames in the
inventory for the connection string instead of IP addresses, and uses
the option in the generate_inventory task and the ansible inventory
action.

Change-Id: I1602e66230255e57c739daaecb7be8cba83b0b6d
Depends-On: Ib923985ae3ba69516c2a2b4835d1a6c0af4b46ba

commit_message:
Add HostsEntry to undercloud's /etc/hosts

Add the overcloud hostnames as entries to /etc/hosts on the undercloud
when using config-download. This will enable using the hostnames in the
ansible inventory which results in much friendlier output of the ansible
tasks/plays reporting about which hosts passed or failed.

Change-Id: Ib923985ae3ba69516c2a2b4835d1a6c0af4b46ba
